ConfigOption.Name: AssociationKey
ConfigOption.Summary: The name of the property in the data to read the association from. Defaults to the name of the associated model.

Attribute.RawValue: The name of the property in the data to read the association from. Defaults to the name of the associated model.

ConfigOption.Name: PrimaryKey
ConfigOption.Summary: The name of the primary key on the associated model. Defaults to 'id'

Attribute.RawValue: The name of the primary key on the associated model. Defaults to 'id'

ConfigOption.Name: Model
ConfigOption.Summary: The string name of the model that is being associated with. Required

Attribute.RawValue: The string name of the model that is being associated with. Required

ConfigOption.Name: Reader
ConfigOption.Summary: A special reader to read associated data

Attribute.RawValue: A special reader to read associated data

ConfigOption.Name: StartDay
ConfigOption.Summary: The 0-based index for the day on which the calendar week begins (0=Sunday, which is the default)

Attribute.RawValue: The 0-based index for the day on which the calendar week begins (0=Sunday, which is the default)

ConfigOption.Name: DDCreateEventText
ConfigOption.Summary: The text to display inside the drag proxy while dragging over the calendar to create a new event (defaults to 'Create event for {0}' where {0} is a date range supplied by the view)

Attribute.RawValue: The text to display inside the drag proxy while dragging over the calendar to create a new event (defaults to 'Create event for {0}' where {0} is a date range supplied by the view)

ConfigOption.Name: DDMoveEventText
ConfigOption.Summary: The text to display inside the drag proxy while dragging an event to reposition it (defaults to 'Move event to {0}' where {0} is the updated event start date/time supplied by the view)

Attribute.RawValue: The text to display inside the drag proxy while dragging an event to reposition it (defaults to 'Move event to {0}' where {0} is the updated event start date/time supplied by the view)

ConfigOption.Name: DDResizeEventText
ConfigOption.Summary: The string displayed to the user in the drag proxy while dragging the resize handle of an event (defaults to 'Update event to {0}' where {0} is the updated event start-end range supplied by the view). Note that this text is only used in views that allow resizing of events.

Attribute.RawValue: The string displayed to the user in the drag proxy while dragging the resize handle of an event (defaults to 'Update event to {0}' where {0} is the updated event start-end range supplied by the view). Note that this text is only used in views that allow resizing of events.

ConfigOption.Name: EnableAddFx
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable a visual effect on adding a new event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doAddFx method.

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable a visual effect on adding a new event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doAddFx method.

ConfigOption.Name: EnableDD
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable drag and drop in the calendar view (the default), false to disable it

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable drag and drop in the calendar view (the default), false to disable it

ConfigOption.Name: EnableFx
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable a visual effect on adding a new event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doAddFx method.

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable a visual effect on adding a new event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doAddFx method.

ConfigOption.Name: EnableRemoveFx
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable a visual effect on removing an event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doRemoveFx method.

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable a visual effect on removing an event (the default), false to disable it. Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doRemoveFx method.

ConfigOption.Name: EnableUpdateFx
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable a visual effect on updating an event, false to disable it (the default). Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doUpdateFx method.

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable a visual effect on updating an event, false to disable it (the default). Note that if enableFx is false it will override this value. The specific effect that runs is defined in the doUpdateFx method.

ConfigOption.Name: MonitorResize
ConfigOption.Summary: True to monitor the browser's resize event (the default), false to ignore it. If the calendar view is rendered into a fixed-size container this can be set to false. However, if the view can change dimensions (e.g., it's in fit layout in a viewport or some other resizable container) it is very important that this config is true so that any resize event propagates properly to all subcomponents and layouts get recalculated properly.

Attribute.RawValue: True to monitor the browser's resize event (the default), false to ignore it. If the calendar view is rendered into a fixed-size container this can be set to false. However, if the view can change dimensions (e.g., it's in fit layout in a viewport or some other resizable container) it is very important that this config is true so that any resize event propagates properly to all subcomponents and layouts get recalculated properly.

ConfigOption.Name: SpansHavePriority
ConfigOption.Summary: Allows switching between two different modes of rendering events that span multiple days. When true, span events are always sorted first, possibly at the expense of start dates being out of order (e.g., a span event that starts at 11am one day and spans into the next day would display before a non-spanning event that starts at 10am, even though they would not be in date order). This can lead to more compact layouts when there are many overlapping events. If false (the default), events will always sort by start date first which can result in a less compact, but chronologically consistent layout.

Attribute.RawValue: Allows switching between two different modes of rendering events that span multiple days. When true, span events are always sorted first, possibly at the expense of start dates being out of order (e.g., a span event that starts at 11am one day and spans into the next day would display before a non-spanning event that starts at 10am, even though they would not be in date order). This can lead to more compact layouts when there are many overlapping events. If false (the default), events will always sort by start date first which can result in a less compact, but chronologically consistent layout.

ConfigOption.Name: TrackMouseOver
ConfigOption.Summary: Whether or not the view tracks and responds to the browser mouseover event on contained elements (defaults to true). If you don't need mouseover event highlighting you can disable this.

Attribute.RawValue: Whether or not the view tracks and responds to the browser mouseover event on contained elements (defaults to true). If you don't need mouseover event highlighting you can disable this.

ConfigOption.Name: GetEventBodyMarkup
ConfigOption.Summary: Returns a string of HTML template markup to be used as the body portion of the event template created by getEventTemplate. This provdes the flexibility to customize what's in the body without having to override the entire XTemplate. This string can include any valid Ext.Template code, and any data tokens accessible to the containing event template can be referenced in this string.

Attribute.RawValue: Returns a string of HTML template markup to be used as the body portion of the event template created by getEventTemplate. This provdes the flexibility to customize what's in the body without having to override the entire XTemplate. This string can include any valid Ext.Template code, and any data tokens accessible to the containing event template can be referenced in this string.

ConfigOption.Name: GetEventTemplate
ConfigOption.Summary: Returns the XTemplate that is bound to the calendar's event store to populate the calendar views with events.

Attribute.RawValue: Returns the XTemplate that is bound to the calendar's event store to populate the calendar views with events.

ConfigOption.Name: ApplyTo

Attribute.RawValue: Specify the id of the element, a DOM element or an existing Element corresponding to a DIV that is already present in the document that specifies some structural markup for this component.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoEl
ConfigOption.Summary: A tag name or DomHelper spec used to create the Element which will encapsulate this AbstractComponent.

Attribute.RawValue: A tag name or DomHelper spec used to create the Element which will encapsulate this AbstractComponent.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoRender
ConfigOption.Summary: This config is intended mainly for floating Components which may or may not be shown. Instead of using renderTo in the configuration, and rendering upon construction, this allows a AbstractComponent to render itself upon first show. Default is false.

Attribute.RawValue: This config is intended mainly for floating Components which may or may not be shown. Instead of using renderTo in the configuration, and rendering upon construction, this allows a AbstractComponent to render itself upon first show. Default is false.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoRenderElement
ConfigOption.Summary: This config is intended mainly for floating Components which may or may not be shown. Instead of using renderTo in the configuration, and rendering upon construction, this allows a AbstractComponent to render itself upon first show. Default is false.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoShow

ConfigOption.Name: BaseCls
ConfigOption.Summary: The base CSS class to apply to this components's element. This will also be prepended to elements within this component like Panel's body will get a class x-panel-body. This means that if you create a subclass of Panel, and you want it to get all the Panels styling for the element and the body, you leave the baseCls x-panel and use componentCls to add specific styling for this component.

Attribute.RawValue: The base CSS class to apply to this components's element. This will also be prepended to elements within this component like Panel's body will get a class x-panel-body. This means that if you create a subclass of Panel, and you want it to get all the Panels styling for the element and the body, you leave the baseCls x-panel and use componentCls to add specific styling for this component.

ConfigOption.Name: FormBind
ConfigOption.Summary: Any component within the FormPanel can be configured with formBind: true. This will cause that component to be automatically disabled when the form is invalid, and enabled when it is valid. This is most commonly used for Button components to prevent submitting the form in an invalid state, but can be used on any component type.

Attribute.RawValue: Any component within the FormPanel can be configured with formBind: true. This will cause that component to be automatically disabled when the form is invalid, and enabled when it is valid. This is most commonly used for Button components to prevent submitting the form in an invalid state, but can be used on any component type.

ConfigOption.Name: Hidden

ConfigOption.Name: MaskOnDisable
ConfigOption.Summary: This is an internal flag that you use when creating custom components. By default this is set to true which means that every component gets a mask when its disabled. Components like FieldContainer, FieldSet, Field, Button, Tab override this property to false since they want to implement custom disable logic.

ConfigOption.Name: Plugins
ConfigOption.Summary: An object or array of objects that will provide custom functionality for this component. The only requirement for a valid plugin is that it contain an init method that accepts a reference of type Ext.AbstractComponent. When a component is created, if any plugins are available, the component will call the init method on each plugin, passing a reference to itself. Each plugin can then call methods or respond to events on the component as needed to provide its functionality.

Attribute.RawValue: An object or array of objects that will provide custom functionality for this component. The only requirement for a valid plugin is that it contain an init method that accepts a reference of type Ext.AbstractComponent. When a component is created, if any plugins are available, the component will call the init method on each plugin, passing a reference to itself. Each plugin can then call methods or respond to events on the component as needed to provide its functionality.

This config option is used only when lazy instantiation is being used, and a child items of a Container is being specified not as a fully instantiated AbstractComponent, but as a AbstractComponent config object. The xtype will be looked up at render time up to determine what type of child AbstractComponent to create.

ConfigOption.Name: Region

Attribute.RawValue: Note: this config is only used when this AbstractComponent is rendered by a Container which has been configured to use the BorderLayout layout manager (e.g. specifying layout:'border').

ConfigOption.Name: Split
ConfigOption.Summary: True to create a SplitRegion and display a 5px wide Ext.SplitBar between this region and its neighbor, allowing the user to resize the regions dynamically. Defaults to false creating a Region. Note: this config is only used when this BoxComponent is rendered by a Container which has been configured to use the BorderLayout layout manager (e.g. specifying layout:'border').

Attribute.RawValue: True to create a SplitRegion and display a 5px wide Ext.SplitBar between this region and its neighbor, allowing the user to resize the regions dynamically. ConfigOption.Name: ColumnWidth
ConfigOption.Summary: The ColumnWidth property is only used with ColumnLayout is used. The ColumnWidth property is always evaluated as a percentage, and must be a decimal value greater than 0 and less than 1.

Attribute.RawValue: The ColumnWidth property is only used with ColumnLayout is used. The ColumnWidth property is always evaluated as a percentage, and must be a decimal value greater than 0 and less than 1.

ConfigOption.Name: Flex
ConfigOption.Summary: NOTE: This property is only used when the parent Layout is HBoxLayout or VBoxLayout. This configuation option is to be applied to child items of the container managed by this layout. Each child item with a flex property will be flexed horizontally according to each item's relative flex value compared to the sum of all items with a flex value specified. Any child items that have either a flex = 0 or flex = undefined will not be 'flexed' (the initial size will not be changed).

Attribute.RawValue: NOTE: This property is only used when the parent Layout is HBoxLayout or VBoxLayout. This configuation option is to be applied to child items of the container managed by this layout. Each child item with a flex property will be flexed horizontally according to each item's relative flex value compared to the sum of all items with a flex value specified. Any child items that have either a flex = 0 or flex = undefined will not be 'flexed' (the initial size will not be changed).

Class.Name: AbstractContainer
Class.Summary: An abstract base class which provides shared methods for Containers across the Sencha product line.

ConfigOption.Name: ActiveItem
ConfigOption.Summary: A string component id or the numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the container's layout on render. For example, activeItem: 'item-1' or activeItem: 0 (index 0 = the first item in the container's collection). activeItem only applies to layout styles that can display items one at a time (like Ext.layout.container.Card and Ext.layout.container.Fit)

Attribute.RawValue: A string component id or the numeric index of the component that should be initially activated within the container's layout on render. ConfigOption.Name: DeferInitialRefresh

ConfigOption.Name: DisableSelection
ConfigOption.Summary: True to disable selection within the DataView. Defaults to false. This configuration will lock the selection model that the DataView uses.

ConfigOption.Name: EmptyText

ConfigOption.Name: ItemSelector
ConfigOption.Summary: This is a required setting. A simple CSS selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child) that will be used to determine what nodes this DataView will be working with. The itemSelector is used to map DOM nodes to records. As such, there should only be one root level element that matches the selector for each record.

Attribute.RawValue: This is a required setting. A simple CSS selector (e.g. div.some-class or span:first-child) that will be used to determine what nodes this DataView will be working with. The itemSelector is used to map DOM nodes to records. As such, there should only be one root level element that matches the selector for each record.

Attribute.RawValue: The inner portion of the item template to be rendered. Follows an XTemplate structure and will be placed inside of a tpl.

ConfigOption.Name: LoadMask

ConfigOption.Name: LoadingUseMsg

Attribute.RawValue: Whether or not to use a loading message class or simply mask the bound element.

ConfigOption.Name: LoadingHeight
ConfigOption.Summary: If specified, gives an explicit height for the data view when it is showing the loadingText, if that is specified. This is useful to prevent the view's height from collapsing to zero when the loading mask is applied and there are no other contents in the data view. Defaults to undefined.

Attribute.RawValue: If specified, gives an explicit height for the data view when it is showing the loadingText, if that is specified. This is useful to prevent the view's height from collapsing to zero when the loading mask is applied and there are no other contents in the data view. Defaults to undefined.

ConfigOption.Name: LoadingText
ConfigOption.Summary: A string to display during data load operations (defaults to undefined). If specified, this text will be displayed in a loading div and the view's contents will be cleared while loading, otherwise the view's contents will continue to display normally until the new data is loaded and the contents are replaced.Defaults to: \"Loading...\"

Attribute.RawValue: A string to display during data load operations (defaults to undefined). If specified, this text will be displayed in a loading div and the view's contents will be cleared while loading, otherwise the view's contents will continue to display normally until the new data is loaded and the contents are replaced.Defaults to: \"Loading...\"

ConfigOption.Name: MultiSelect
ConfigOption.Summary: True to allow selection of more than one item at a time, false to allow selection of only a single item at a time or no selection at all, depending on the value of singleSelect (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: CloseAction
ConfigOption.Summary: The action to take when the Panel is closed. The default action is 'close' which will actually remove the Panel from the DOM and destroy it. The other valid option is 'hide' which will simply hide the Panel by setting visibility to hidden and applying negative offsets, keeping the Panel available to be redisplayed via the show method.

If the Panel has no header, then a new header (orientated correctly depending on the collapseDirection) will be inserted to show a the title and a re-expand tool.

If you manually add rounded corners to a panel header which does not have frame:true, this will need to be set to true.

ConfigOption.Name: DefaultDockWeights
ConfigOption.Summary: This object holds the default weights applied to dockedItems that have no weight. These start with a weight of 1, to allow negative weights to insert before top items and are odd numbers so that even weights can be used to get between different dock orders. Defaults to: {top: 1, left: 3, right: 5, bottom: 7}. A string must be the four numbers separated by space symbols. The first number is a top dock weight, the second one - left, the third one - right, the fourth one - bottom.

Attribute.RawValue: This object holds the default weights applied to dockedItems that have no weight. These start with a weight of 1, to allow negative weights to insert before top items and are odd numbers so that even weights can be used to get between different dock orders. The first number is a top dock weight, the second one - left, the third one - right, the fourth one - bottom.

ConfigOption.Summary: The numeric index of the tab that should be initially activated on render.

ConfigOption.Name: TabAlign
ConfigOption.Summary: The alignment of the Tabs (defaults to 'Left'). Other option includes 'Right'. Note that tab scrolling is only supported for TabAlign='Left'. Note that when 'Right', the Tabs will be rendered in reverse order.

Attribute.RawValue: The alignment of the Tabs (defaults to 'Left'). Other option includes 'Right'. Note that tab scrolling is only supported for TabAlign='Left'. Note that when 'Right', the Tabs will be rendered in reverse order.

ConfigOption.Name: RemovePanelHeader
ConfigOption.Summary: True to instruct each Panel added to the TabContainer to not render its header element. This is to ensure that the title of the panel does not appear twice. Defaults to: true

Method.Summary: Sets the specified tab as the active tab. This method fires the beforetabchange event which can return false to cancel the tab change.

Attribute.RawValue: Sets the specified tab as the active tab. This method fires the beforetabchange event which can return false to cancel the tab change.

Method.Name: SetActiveTab
Method.Summary: Sets the specified tab as the active tab. This method fires the beforetabchange event which can return false to cancel the tab change.

Attribute.RawValue: Sets the specified tab as the active tab. This method fires the beforetabchange event which can return false to cancel the tab change.

Method.Name: SetActiveTab
Method.Summary: Sets the specified tab as the active tab. This method fires the beforetabchange event which can return false to cancel the tab change.

Attribute.RawValue: Sets the specified tab as the active tab. This method fires the beforetabchange event which can return false to cancel the tab change.

ConfigOption.Name: Field
ConfigOption.Summary: The name of the field to validate

Attribute.RawValue: The name of the field to validate

ConfigOption.Name: Message
ConfigOption.Summary: The error message used when a validation fails

Attribute.RawValue: The error message used when a validation fails

ConfigOption.Name: AnimateTarget
ConfigOption.Summary: Id or element from which the window should animate while opening (defaults to null with no animation).

Attribute.RawValue: Id or element from which the window should animate while opening (defaults to null with no animation).

ConfigOption.Name: Closable
ConfigOption.Summary: True to display the 'close' tool button and allow the user to close the window, false to hide the button and disallow closing the window (default to true).

Attribute.RawValue: True to display the 'close' tool button and allow the user to close the window, false to hide the button and disallow closing the window (default to true).

ConfigOption.Name: CloseAction
ConfigOption.Summary: The action to take when the close button is clicked. The default action is 'close' which will actually remove the window from the DOM and destroy it. The other valid option is 'hide' which will simply hide the window by setting visibility to hidden and applying negative offsets, keeping the window available to be redisplayed via the show method.

Attribute.RawValue: The action to take when the close button is clicked. The default action is 'close' which will actually remove the window from the DOM and destroy it. The other valid option is 'hide' which will simply hide the window by setting visibility to hidden and applying negative offsets, keeping the window available to be redisplayed via the show method.

ConfigOption.Name: Constrain
ConfigOption.Summary: True to constrain the window within its containing element, false to allow it to fall outside of its containing element. By default the window will be rendered to document.body. To render and constrain the window within another element specify renderTo. (defaults to false). Optionally the header only can be constrained using constrainHeader.

Attribute.RawValue: True to constrain the window within its containing element, false to allow it to fall outside of its containing element. By default the window will be rendered to document.body. To render and constrain the window within another element specify renderTo. (defaults to false). Optionally the header only can be constrained using constrainHeader.

ConfigOption.Name: ConstrainHeader
ConfigOption.Summary: True to constrain the window header within its containing element (allowing the window body to fall outside of its containing element) or false to allow the header to fall outside its containing element (defaults to false). Optionally the entire window can be constrained using constrain.

Attribute.RawValue: True to constrain the window header within its containing element (allowing the window body to fall outside of its containing element) or false to allow the header to fall outside its containing element (defaults to false). Optionally the entire window can be constrained using constrain.

ConfigOption.Name: DefaultFocus
ConfigOption.Summary: The id of a button to focus when this window received the focus.

Attribute.RawValue: The id of a button to focus when this window received the focus.

ConfigOption.Name: DefaultRenderTo
ConfigOption.Summary: The default render to Element (Body or Form). Using when AutoRender='false'

Attribute.RawValue: The default render to Element (Body or Form). Using when AutoRender='false'

ConfigOption.Name: Draggable
ConfigOption.Summary: True to allow the window to be dragged by the header bar, false to disable dragging (defaults to true). Note that by default the window will be centered in the viewport, so if dragging is disabled the window may need to be positioned programmatically after render (e.g., myWindow.setPosition(100, 100);).

Attribute.RawValue: True to allow the window to be dragged by the header bar, false to disable dragging (defaults to true). Note that by default the window will be centered in the viewport, so if dragging is disabled the window may need to be positioned programmatically after render (e.g., myWindow.setPosition(100, 100);).

ConfigOption.Name: ExpandOnShow
ConfigOption.Summary: True to always expand the window when it is displayed, false to keep it in its current state (which may be collapsed) when displayed (defaults to true).

Attribute.RawValue: True to always expand the window when it is displayed, false to keep it in its current state (which may be collapsed) when displayed (defaults to true).

ConfigOption.Name: Hidden
ConfigOption.Summary: Render this Window hidden (default is true). If true, the hide method will be called internally.

Attribute.RawValue: Render this Window hidden (default is true). If true, the hide method will be called internally.

ConfigOption.Name: Maximizable
ConfigOption.Summary: True to display the 'maximize' tool button and allow the user to maximize the window, false to hide the button and disallow maximizing the window (defaults to false). Note that when a window is maximized, the tool button will automatically change to a 'restore' button with the appropriate behavior already built-in that will restore the window to its previous size.

Attribute.RawValue: True to display the 'maximize' tool button and allow the user to maximize the window, false to hide the button and disallow maximizing the window (defaults to false). Note that when a window is maximized, the tool button will automatically change to a 'restore' button with the appropriate behavior already built-in that will restore the window to its previous size.

ConfigOption.Name: Maximized
ConfigOption.Summary: True to initially display the window in a maximized state. (Defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to initially display the window in a maximized state. (Defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: Minimizable
ConfigOption.Summary: True to display the 'minimize' tool button and allow the user to minimize the window, false to hide the button and disallow minimizing the window (defaults to false). Note that this button provides no implementation -- the behavior of minimizing a window is implementation-specific, so the minimize event must be handled and a custom minimize behavior implemented for this option to be useful.

Attribute.RawValue: True to display the 'minimize' tool button and allow the user to minimize the window, false to hide the button and disallow minimizing the window (defaults to false). Note that this button provides no implementation -- the behavior of minimizing a window is implementation-specific, so the minimize event must be handled and a custom minimize behavior implemented for this option to be useful.

ConfigOption.Name: Modal
ConfigOption.Summary: True to make the window modal and mask everything behind it when displayed, false to display it without restricting access to other UI elements (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to make the window modal and mask everything behind it when displayed, false to display it without restricting access to other UI elements (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: OnEsc
ConfigOption.Summary: Allows override of the built-in processing for the escape key. Default action is to close the Window (performing whatever action is specified in closeAction. To prevent the Window closing when the escape key is pressed, specify this as Ext.emptyFn (See Ext.emptyFn).

Attribute.RawValue: Allows override of the built-in processing for the escape key. Default action is to close the Window (performing whatever action is specified in closeAction. To prevent the Window closing when the escape key is pressed, specify this as Ext.emptyFn (See Ext.emptyFn).

ConfigOption.Name: Plain
ConfigOption.Summary: True to render the window body with a transparent background so that it will blend into the framing elements, false to add a lighter background color to visually highlight the body element and separate it more distinctly from the surrounding frame (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to render the window body with a transparent background so that it will blend into the framing elements, false to add a lighter background color to visually highlight the body element and separate it more distinctly from the surrounding frame (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: Width
ConfigOption.Summary: The width of this component in pixels.

Attribute.RawValue: The width of this component in pixels.

ConfigOption.Name: Height
ConfigOption.Summary: The height of this component in pixels.

Attribute.RawValue: The height of this component in pixels.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoRender
ConfigOption.Summary: This config is intended mainly for floating Components which may or may not be shown. Instead of using renderTo in the configuration, and rendering upon construction, this allows a AbstractComponent to render itself upon first show. Default is false.

Attribute.RawValue: This config is intended mainly for floating Components which may or may not be shown. Instead of using renderTo in the configuration, and rendering upon construction, this allows a AbstractComponent to render itself upon first show. Default is false.

Method.Name: Hide
Method.Summary: Hides the window, setting it to invisible and applying negative offsets.

Attribute.RawValue: Hides the window, setting it to invisible and applying negative offsets.

Method.Summary: Hides the window, setting it to invisible and applying negative offsets.

Attribute.RawValue: Hides the window, setting it to invisible and applying negative offsets.

Attribute.RawValue: Hides the window, setting it to invisible and applying negative offsets.

Method.Name: Maximize
Method.Summary: Fits the window within its current container and automatically replaces the 'maximize' tool button with the 'restore' tool button.

Attribute.RawValue: Fits the window within its current container and automatically replaces the 'maximize' tool button with the 'restore' tool button.

Method.Name: Minimize
Method.Summary: Placeholder method for minimizing the window. By default, this method simply fires the minimize event since the behavior of minimizing a window is application-specific. To implement custom minimize behavior, either the minimize event can be handled or this method can be overridden.

Attribute.RawValue: Placeholder method for minimizing the window. By default, this method simply fires the minimize event since the behavior of minimizing a window is application-specific. To implement custom minimize behavior, either the minimize event can be handled or this method can be overridden.

Method.Name: Restore
Method.Summary: Restores a maximized window back to its original size and position prior to being maximized and also replaces the 'restore' tool button with the 'maximize' tool button.

Attribute.RawValue: Restores a maximized window back to its original size and position prior to being maximized and also replaces the 'restore' tool button with the 'maximize' tool button.

Method.Summary: Sets the target element from which the window should animate while opening.

Attribute.RawValue: Sets the target element from which the window should animate while opening.

Method.Name: SetAnimateTarget
Method.Summary: Sets the target element from which the window should animate while opening.

Attribute.RawValue: Sets the target element from which the window should animate while opening.

Method.Summary: A shortcut method for toggling between maximize and restore based on the current maximized state of the window.

Attribute.RawValue: A shortcut method for toggling between maximize and restore based on the current maximized state of the window.

ConfigOption.Name: NameProperty
ConfigOption.Summary: This property is used to read the key for each value that will be sent to the server.

Attribute.RawValue: This property is used to read the key for each value that will be sent to the server.

ConfigOption.Name: WriteAllFields
ConfigOption.Summary: True to write all fields from the record to the server. If set to false it will only send the fields that were modified. Defaults to true.

Attribute.RawValue: True to write all fields from the record to the server. If set to false it will only send the fields that were modified. Defaults to true.

ConfigOption.Name: GetRecordData
ConfigOption.Summary: Formats the data for each record before sending it to the server. This method should be overridden to format the data in a way that differs from the default.

Attribute.RawValue: Formats the data for each record before sending it to the server. This method should be overridden to format the data in a way that differs from the default.

ConfigOption.Name: ActiveOnTop
ConfigOption.Summary: True to swap the position of each panel as it is expanded so that it becomes the first item in the container, false to keep the panels in the rendered order. This is NOT compatible with \"animate:true\" (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to swap the position of each panel as it is expanded so that it becomes the first item in the container, false to keep the panels in the rendered order. This is NOT compatible with \"animate:true\" (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: OriginalHeader
ConfigOption.Summary: If true then original header UI is used

Attribute.RawValue: If true then original header UI is used

ConfigOption.Name: CollapseFirst
ConfigOption.Summary: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the contained panels' title bars, false to render it last (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to make sure the collapse/expand toggle button always renders first (to the left of) any other tools in the contained panels' title bars, false to render it last (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: Fill
ConfigOption.Summary: True to adjust the active item's height to fill the available space in the container, false to use the item's current height, or auto height if not explicitly set (defaults to true).

Attribute.RawValue: True to adjust the active item's height to fill the available space in the container, false to use the item's current height, or auto height if not explicitly set (defaults to true).

ConfigOption.Name: HideCollapseTool
ConfigOption.Summary: True to hide the contained panels' collapse/expand toggle buttons, false to display them (defaults to false). When set to true, titleCollapse should be true also.

Attribute.RawValue: True to hide the contained panels' collapse/expand toggle buttons, false to display them (defaults to false). When set to true, titleCollapse should be true also.

ConfigOption.Name: Multi
ConfigOption.Summary: Defaults to false. Set to true to enable multiple accordion items to be open at once.

Attribute.RawValue: Defaults to false. Set to true to enable multiple accordion items to be open at once.

ConfigOption.Name: TitleCollapse
ConfigOption.Summary: True to allow expand/collapse of each contained panel by clicking anywhere on the title bar, false to allow expand/collapse only when the toggle tool button is clicked (defaults to true). When set to false, hideCollapseTool should be false also.

Attribute.RawValue: True to allow expand/collapse of each contained panel by clicking anywhere on the title bar, false to allow expand/collapse only when the toggle tool button is clicked (defaults to true). When set to false, hideCollapseTool should be false also.

ConfigOption.Name: AltText
ConfigOption.Summary: The alt text to use for the image element. Defaults to ''.

Attribute.RawValue: The alt text to use for the image element. Defaults to ''.

ConfigOption.Name: StopSelection
ConfigOption.Summary: Defaults to true. Prevent grid row selection upon mousedown.

Attribute.RawValue: Defaults to true. Prevent grid row selection upon mousedown.

ConfigOption.Name: Icon
ConfigOption.Summary: An icon to apply to the icon image. To determine the class dynamically, configure the item with a getClass function.

Attribute.RawValue: An icon to apply to the icon image. To determine the class dynamically, configure the item with a getClass function.

ConfigOption.Name: IconCls
ConfigOption.Summary: A CSS class to apply to the icon image. To determine the class dynamically, configure the item with a getClass function.

Attribute.RawValue: A CSS class to apply to the icon image. To determine the class dynamically, configure the item with a getClass function.

ConfigOption.Name: IconUrl
ConfigOption.Summary: The url of an image to display as the clickable element in the column.

ConfigOption.Name: GetClass
ConfigOption.Summary: A function which returns the CSS class to apply to the icon image.

Attribute.RawValue: A function which returns the CSS class to apply to the icon image.

ConfigOption.Name: Handler
ConfigOption.Summary: A function called when the icon is clicked.

Attribute.RawValue: A function called when the icon is clicked.

ConfigOption.Summary: The scope (this reference) in which the handler and getClass functions are executed. Fallback defaults are this Column's configured scope, then this Column.

Attribute.RawValue: The scope (this reference) in which the handler and getClass functions are executed. Fallback defaults are this Column's configured scope, then this Column.

ConfigOption.Name: Tooltip
ConfigOption.Summary: A tooltip message to be displayed on hover. Ext.tip.QuickTipManager must have been initialized.

Attribute.RawValue: A tooltip message to be displayed on hover. Ext.tip.QuickTipManager must have been initialized.

ConfigOption.Name: DisableCaching
ConfigOption.Summary: True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests. (defaults to true)

Attribute.RawValue: True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests. (defaults to true)

ConfigOption.Name: DisableCachingParam
ConfigOption.Summary: Change the parameter which is sent went disabling caching through a cache buster. Defaults to '_dc'

Attribute.RawValue: Change the parameter which is sent went disabling caching through a cache buster. Defaults to '_dc'

ConfigOption.Name: Timeout
ConfigOption.Summary: The timeout in milliseconds to be used for requests. (defaults to 30000)

Attribute.RawValue: The timeout in milliseconds to be used for requests. (defaults to 30000)

ConfigOption.Name: Url
ConfigOption.Summary: The URL to which to send the request, or a function to call which returns a URL string. The scope of the function is specified by the scope option. Defaults to the configured url.

Attribute.RawValue: The URL to which to send the request, or a function to call which returns a URL string. The scope of the function is specified by the scope option. Defaults to the configured url.

ConfigOption.Name: UrlProxy
ConfigOption.Summary: The default URL to be used for requests to the server if DirectEventType.Request. (defaults to '')

Attribute.RawValue: The default URL to be used for requests to the server if DirectEventType.Request. (defaults to '')

ConfigOption.Name: Method
ConfigOption.Summary: The HTTP method to use for the request. Defaults to the configured method, or if no method was configured, \"GET\" if no parameters are being sent, and \"POST\" if parameters are being sent. Note that the method name is case-sensitive and should be all caps.

Attribute.RawValue: The HTTP method to use for the request. Defaults to the configured method, or if no method was configured, \"GET\" if no parameters are being sent, and \"POST\" if parameters are being sent. Note that the method name is case-sensitive and should be all caps.

ConfigOption.Name: IsUpload
ConfigOption.Summary: True if the form object is a file upload

Attribute.RawValue: True if the form object is a file upload

ConfigOption.Name: Json
ConfigOption.Summary: JSON data to use as the post.

Attribute.RawValue: JSON data to use as the post.

ConfigOption.Name: Xml
ConfigOption.Summary: XML document to use for the post.

Attribute.RawValue: XML document to use for the post.

ConfigOption.Name: FormID
ConfigOption.Summary: The id of the form to submit. If this.ParentForm is not null then this.ParentForm.ClientID is used, else if FormID is empty the Page.Form.ClientID is used, else try to find the form in dom tree hierarchy, otherwise the Url of current page is used.

Attribute.RawValue: The id of the form to submit. If this.ParentForm is not null then this.ParentForm.ClientID is used, else if FormID is empty the Page.Form.ClientID is used, else try to find the form in dom tree hierarchy, otherwise the Url of current page is used.

ConfigOption.Name: Headers
ConfigOption.Summary: An object containing request headers which are added to each request made by this object.

Attribute.RawValue: An object containing request headers which are added to each request made by this object.

ConfigOption.Name: Headers
ConfigOption.Summary: Any headers to add to the Ajax request. Defaults to undefined.

ConfigOption.Summary: Send params as XML object

ConfigOption.Summary: Returns the HTTP method name for a given request. By default this returns based on a lookup on actionMethods.

Attribute.RawValue: Returns the HTTP method name for a given request. By default this returns based on a lookup on actionMethods.

ConfigOption.Name: Height
ConfigOption.Summary: The height of this Anchor in pixels (defaults to auto).

ConfigOption.Name: Width
ConfigOption.Summary: The width of this Anchor in pixels (defaults to auto).

Attribute.RawValue: The width of this Anchor in pixels (defaults to auto).

ConfigOption.Summary: Default anchor for all child container items applied if no anchor or specific width is set on the child item. Defaults to '100%'.

Attribute.RawValue: Default anchor for all child container items applied if no anchor or specific width is set on the child item. Defaults to '100%'.

ConfigOption.Name: Alternate
ConfigOption.Summary: Used in conjunction with iterations to reverse the animation each time an iteration completes.

Attribute.RawValue: Used in conjunction with iterations to reverse the animation each time an iteration completes.

ConfigOption.Name: Delay
ConfigOption.Summary: Time to delay before starting the animation. Defaults to 0.

Attribute.RawValue: Time to delay before starting the animation. Defaults to 0.

ConfigOption.Name: Duration
ConfigOption.Summary: Time in milliseconds for the animation to last. Defaults to 250.

Attribute.RawValue: Time in milliseconds for the animation to last. Defaults to 250.

ConfigOption.Name: Dynamic
ConfigOption.Summary: Currently only for AbstractComponent Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. Set to true to do full layouts for every frame of the animation. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: Currently only for AbstractComponent Animation: Only set a component's outer element size bypassing layouts. Set to true to do full layouts for every frame of the animation. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: Easing
ConfigOption.Summary: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

Attribute.RawValue: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

ConfigOption.Name: EasingArgs
ConfigOption.Summary: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

Attribute.RawValue: This describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated. It allows for a transition to change speed over its duration.

ConfigOption.Name: From
ConfigOption.Summary: An object containing property/value pairs for the beginning of the animation. If not specified, the current state of the Ext.fx.target will be used.

Attribute.RawValue: An object containing property/value pairs for the beginning of the animation. If not specified, the current state of the Ext.fx.target will be used.

ConfigOption.Name: Iterations
ConfigOption.Summary: Number of times to execute the animation. Defaults to 1.

Attribute.RawValue: Number of times to execute the animation. Defaults to 1.

ConfigOption.Name: KeyFrames
ConfigOption.Summary: Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern.

Attribute.RawValue: Animation keyframes follow the CSS3 Animation configuration pattern.

ConfigOption.Name: Reverse
ConfigOption.Summary: Run the animation from the end to the beginning. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: Run the animation from the end to the beginning. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: To
ConfigOption.Summary: An object containing property/value pairs for the end of the animation.

Attribute.RawValue: An object containing property/value pairs for the end of the animation.

ConfigOption.Name: AfterAnimate
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires when the animation is complete.

Attribute.RawValue: Fires when the animation is complete.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeAnimate
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires before the animation starts. A handler can return false to cancel the animation.

Attribute.RawValue: Fires before the animation starts. A handler can return false to cancel the animation.

ConfigOption.Name: LastFrame
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires when the animation's last frame has been set.

Attribute.RawValue: Fires when the animation's last frame has been set.

Class.Name: App
Class.Summary: Represents an Application, which is typically a single page app using a Viewport.

Attribute.RawValue: Represents an Application, which is typically a single page app using a Viewport.

ConfigOption.Name: Name
ConfigOption.Summary: The name of your application. This will also be the namespace for your views, controllers models and stores. Don't use spaces or special characters in the name.

Attribute.RawValue: The name of your application. This will also be the namespace for your views, controllers models and stores. Don't use spaces or special characters in the name.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeLoad
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires before this node is loaded, return false to cancel

Attribute.RawValue: Fires before this node is loaded, return false to cancel

ConfigOption.Name: Load
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires when this node is loaded

Attribute.RawValue: Fires when this node is loaded

ConfigOption.Name: DashSize
ConfigOption.Summary: The size of the dash marker. Default's 3.

Attribute.RawValue: The size of the dash marker. Default's 3.

ConfigOption.Name: Grid
ConfigOption.Summary: The grid configuration enables you to set a background grid for an axis. If set to true on a vertical axis, vertical lines will be drawn. If set to true on a horizontal axis, horizontal lines will be drawn. If both are set, a proper grid with horizontal and vertical lines will be drawn.

Attribute.RawValue: The grid configuration enables you to set a background grid for an axis. If set to true on a vertical axis, vertical lines will be drawn. If set to true on a horizontal axis, horizontal lines will be drawn. If both are set, a proper grid with horizontal and vertical lines will be drawn.

ConfigOption.Name: Length
ConfigOption.Summary: Offset axis position. Default's 0.

ConfigOption.Name: MajorTickSteps
ConfigOption.Summary: If minimum and maximum are specified it forces the number of major ticks to the specified value.

Attribute.RawValue: If minimum and maximum are specified it forces the number of major ticks to the specified value.

ConfigOption.Name: MinorTickSteps
ConfigOption.Summary: The number of small ticks between two major ticks. Default is zero.

Attribute.RawValue: The number of small ticks between two major ticks. Default is zero.

ConfigOption.Name: Position
ConfigOption.Summary: Where to set the axis. Available options are left, bottom, right, top.

Attribute.RawValue: Where to set the axis. Available options are left, bottom, right, top.

ConfigOption.Name: Title
ConfigOption.Summary: The title for the Axis

ConfigOption.Name: Width
ConfigOption.Summary: Offset axis width. Default's 0.

ConfigOption.Name: Column
ConfigOption.Summary: Whether to set the visualization as column chart or horizontal bar chart.

Attribute.RawValue: Whether to set the visualization as column chart or horizontal bar chart.

ConfigOption.Name: GroupGutter
ConfigOption.Summary: The gutter space between groups of bars, as a percentage of the bar width. Defaults to: 38.2

Attribute.RawValue: The gutter space between groups of bars, as a percentage of the bar width. Defaults to: 38.2

ConfigOption.Name: Gutter
ConfigOption.Summary: The gutter space between single bars, as a percentage of the bar width. Defaults to: 38.2

Attribute.RawValue: The gutter space between single bars, as a percentage of the bar width. Defaults to: 38.2

ConfigOption.Name: XPadding
ConfigOption.Summary: Padding between the left/right axes and the bars. Defaults to: 0

Attribute.RawValue: Padding between the left/right axes and the bars. Defaults to: 0

ConfigOption.Name: YPadding
ConfigOption.Summary: Padding between the top/bottom axes and the bars. Defaults to: 10

Attribute.RawValue: Padding between the top/bottom axes and the bars. Defaults to: 10

ConfigOption.Name: CleanRequest
ConfigOption.Summary: Only extra params will be added to request. Useful if request has web-service Url

Attribute.RawValue: Only extra params will be added to request. Useful if request has web-service Url

ConfigOption.Name: DisableCaching
ConfigOption.Summary: True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests.

Attribute.RawValue: True to add a unique cache-buster param to GET requests.

ConfigOption.Name: DisableCachingParam
ConfigOption.Summary: Change the parameter which is sent went disabling caching through a cache buster. Defaults to '_dc'

ConfigOption.Summary: True if the form object is a file upload

Attribute.RawValue: True if the form object is a file upload

ConfigOption.Name: Type
ConfigOption.Summary: The type of DirectEvent to perform. The 'Submit' type will submit the <form> and 'Load' will make a POST request to url set in the .Url property, or the current url if the .Url property has not been set.

Attribute.RawValue: The type of DirectEvent to perform. The 'Submit' type will submit the <form> and 'Load' will make a POST request to url set in the .Url property, or the current url if the .Url property has not been set.

ConfigOption.Summary: The default URL to be used for requests to the server if DirectEventType.Request. (defaults to '')

Attribute.RawValue: The default URL to be used for requests to the server if DirectEventType.Request. (defaults to '')

ConfigOption.Summary: The HTTP method to use. Defaults to POST if params are present, or GET if not.

ConfigOption.Summary: The timeout in milliseconds to be used for requests. (defaults to 30000)

ConfigOption.Name: StopEvent
ConfigOption.Summary: True to stop the event. That is stop propagation, and prevent the default action.

Attribute.RawValue: True to stop the event. That is stop propagation, and prevent the default action.

ConfigOption.Name: PreventDefault
ConfigOption.Summary: True to prevent the default action.

Attribute.RawValue: True to prevent the default action.

ConfigOption.Name: StopPropagation
ConfigOption.Summary: True to prevent event propagation.

ConfigOption.Name: Normalized
ConfigOption.Summary: False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject.

Attribute.RawValue: False to pass a browser event to the handler function instead of an Ext.EventObject.

ConfigOption.Name: Delay
ConfigOption.Summary: The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after the event fires.

Attribute.RawValue: The number of milliseconds to delay the invocation of the handler after the event fires.

ConfigOption.Name: Single
ConfigOption.Summary: True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.

Attribute.RawValue: True to add a handler to handle just the next firing of the event, and then remove itself.

ConfigOption.Name: Buffer
ConfigOption.Summary: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

Attribute.RawValue: Causes the handler to be scheduled to run in an Ext.util.DelayedTask delayed by the specified number of milliseconds. If the event fires again within that time, the original handler is not invoked, but the new handler is scheduled in its place.

ConfigOption.Name: Method

Attribute.RawValue: The HTTP method to use. Defaults to POST if params are present, or GET if not.

ConfigOption.Summary: Wrap in quotes or not

Attribute.RawValue: The name of the foreign key on the owner model that links it to the associated model. Defaults to the lowercased name of the associated model plus \"_id\", e.g. an association with a model called Product would set up a product_id foreign key.

Attribute.RawValue: The name of the setter function that will be added to the local model's prototype. Defaults to 'set' + the name of the foreign model, e.g. setCategory

Class.Name: Button
Class.Summary: Simple Button class

ConfigOption.Summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: DirectEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side DirectEventHandlers

ConfigOption.Name: StandOut
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable stand out by default (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable stand out by default (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: OnClientClick
ConfigOption.Summary: The JavaScript to execute when the Button is clicked. Or, please use the <Listeners> for more flexibility.

Attribute.RawValue: The JavaScript to execute when the Button is clicked. Or, please use the <Listeners> for more flexibility.

ConfigOption.Name: AllowDepress
ConfigOption.Summary: False to not allow a pressed Button to be depressed (defaults to true). Only valid when enableToggle is true.

Attribute.RawValue: False to not allow a pressed Button to be depressed (defaults to true). Only valid when enableToggle is true.

ConfigOption.Name: ArrowAlign
ConfigOption.Summary: The side of the Button box to render the arrow if the button has an associated menu. Defaults to 'Right'.

Attribute.RawValue: The side of the Button box to render the arrow if the button has an associated menu. Defaults to 'Right'.

ConfigOption.Name: ArrowCls
ConfigOption.Summary: The className used for the inner arrow element if the button has a menu.

Attribute.RawValue: The className used for the inner arrow element if the button has a menu.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoWidth
ConfigOption.Summary: By default, if a width is not specified the button will attempt to stretch horizontally to fit its content. If the button is being managed by a width sizing layout (hbox, fit, anchor), set this to false to prevent the button from doing this automatic sizing. Defaults to undefined.

Attribute.RawValue: By default, if a width is not specified the button will attempt to stretch horizontally to fit its content. If the button is being managed by a width sizing layout (hbox, fit, anchor), set this to false to prevent the button from doing this automatic sizing. Defaults to undefined.

ConfigOption.Name: BaseParams
ConfigOption.Summary: An object literal of parameters to pass to the url when the href property is specified.

Attribute.RawValue: An object literal of parameters to pass to the url when the href property is specified.

ConfigOption.Name: ClickEvent
ConfigOption.Summary: The DOM event that will fire the handler of the button. This can be any valid event name (dblclick, contextmenu). Defaults to: \"click\"

Attribute.RawValue: The DOM event that will fire the handler of the button. This can be any valid event name (dblclick, contextmenu). Defaults to: \"click\"

ConfigOption.Name: EnableToggle
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable pressed/not pressed toggling (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable pressed/not pressed toggling (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: FocusCls
ConfigOption.Summary: The CSS class to add to a button when it is in the focussed state. Defaults to: \"focus\"

Attribute.RawValue: The CSS class to add to a button when it is in the focussed state. Defaults to: \"focus\"

ConfigOption.Name: Flat
ConfigOption.Summary: True to apply a flat style.

Attribute.RawValue: True to apply a flat style.

ConfigOption.Name: HandleMouseEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: False to disable visual cues on mouseover, mouseout and mousedown (defaults to true).

Attribute.RawValue: False to disable visual cues on mouseover, mouseout and mousedown (defaults to true).

ConfigOption.Name: Handler
ConfigOption.Summary: A function called when the button is clicked (can be used instead of click event).

Attribute.RawValue: A function called when the button is clicked (can be used instead of click event).

ConfigOption.Name: Icon
ConfigOption.Summary: The path to an image to display in the button (the image will be set as the background-image CSS property of the button by default, so if you want a mixed icon/text button, set cls:'x-btn-text-icon')

Attribute.RawValue: The path to an image to display in the button (the image will be set as the background-image CSS property of the button by default, so if you want a mixed icon/text button, set cls:'x-btn-text-icon')

ConfigOption.Summary: The side of the Button box to render the icon. Defaults to 'Left'.

Attribute.RawValue: The side of the Button box to render the icon. Defaults to 'Left'.

ConfigOption.Name: IconCls
ConfigOption.Summary: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button.

Attribute.RawValue: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button.

ConfigOption.Name: IconUrl
ConfigOption.Summary: The path to an image to display in the button (the image will be set as the background-image CSS property of the button by default, so if you want a mixed icon/text button, set cls:'x-btn-text-icon')

Attribute.RawValue: The path to an image to display in the button (the image will be set as the background-image CSS property of the button by default, so if you want a mixed icon/text button, set cls:'x-btn-text-icon')

ConfigOption.Summary: Standard menu attribute consisting of a reference to a menu object, a menu id or a menu config blob.

Attribute.RawValue: Standard menu attribute consisting of a reference to a menu object, a menu id or a menu config blob.

Class.Name: CalendarPanel
Class.Summary: This is the default container for calendar views. It supports day, week, multi-week and month views as well as a built-in event edit form. The only requirement for displaying a calendar is passing in a valid store config containing records of type EventRecord.

Attribute.RawValue: This is the default container for calendar views. It supports day, week, multi-week and month views as well as a built-in event edit form. The only requirement for displaying a calendar is passing in a valid store config containing records of type EventRecord.

ConfigOption.Name: ShowMonthView

ConfigOption.Name: ShowNavBar

ConfigOption.Name: ShowTodayText

ConfigOption.Name: DeferredRender
ConfigOption.Summary: True to render each contained item at the time it becomes active, false to render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered (defaults to false). If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

Attribute.RawValue: True to render each contained item at the time it becomes active, false to render all contained items as soon as the layout is rendered (defaults to false). If there is a significant amount of content or a lot of heavy controls being rendered into panels that are not displayed by default, setting this to true might improve performance.

ConfigOption.Name: Axis
ConfigOption.Summary: The position of the axis to bind the values to. Possible values are 'left', 'bottom', 'top' and 'right'. You must explicitly set this value to bind the values of the line series to the ones in the axis, otherwise a relative scale will be used. Defaults to: \"left\"

Attribute.RawValue: The position of the axis to bind the values to. Possible values are 'left', 'bottom', 'top' and 'right'. You must explicitly set this value to bind the values of the line series to the ones in the axis, otherwise a relative scale will be used. Defaults to: \"left\"

ConfigOption.Name: AutoSize
ConfigOption.Summary: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

Attribute.RawValue: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoSizeConfig
ConfigOption.Summary: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

Attribute.RawValue: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

ConfigOption.Name: AllowBlur
ConfigOption.Summary: True to complete edit complete the editing process if in edit mode when the field is blurred. Defaults to true.

Attribute.RawValue: True to complete edit complete the editing process if in edit mode when the field is blurred. Defaults to true.

ConfigOption.Name: CancelOnEsc
ConfigOption.Summary: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed (defaults to false)

Attribute.RawValue: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed (defaults to false)

ConfigOption.Name: CompleteOnEnter
ConfigOption.Summary: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

Attribute.RawValue: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

ConfigOption.Name: CancelOnBlur
ConfigOption.Summary: True to cancel the edit when the blur event is fired (defaults to false)

Attribute.RawValue: True to cancel the edit when the blur event is fired (defaults to false)

ConfigOption.Name: IgnoreNoChange
ConfigOption.Summary: True to skip the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and the value has not changed (defaults to false). Applies only to string values - edits for other data types will never be ignored.

Attribute.RawValue: True to skip the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and the value has not changed (defaults to false). Applies only to string values - edits for other data types will never be ignored.

ConfigOption.Name: RevertInvalid
ConfigOption.Summary: True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field validation fails (defaults to true)

Attribute.RawValue: True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field validation fails (defaults to true)

ConfigOption.Name: Shadow

Attribute.RawValue: Handle the keydown/keypress events so they don't propagate (defaults to true)

ConfigOption.Summary: Turns on/off keyboard navigation within the grid. Defaults to true.

ConfigOption.Name: ColumnsNumber
ConfigOption.Summary: Specifies a number of columns will be created and the contained controls will be automatically distributed based on the value of vertical.

Attribute.RawValue: Specifies a number of columns will be created and the contained controls will be automatically distributed based on the value of vertical.

ConfigOption.Name: ColumnsWidths
ConfigOption.Summary: You can also specify an array of column widths, mixing integer (fixed width) and float (percentage width) values as needed (e.g., [100, .25, .75]). Any integer values will be rendered first, then any float values will be calculated as a percentage of the remaining space. Float values do not have to add up to 1 (100%) although if you want the controls to take up the entire field container you should do so.

Attribute.RawValue: You can also specify an array of column widths, mixing integer (fixed width) and float (percentage width) values as needed (e.g., [100, .25, .75]). Any integer values will be rendered first, then any float values will be calculated as a percentage of the remaining space. Float values do not have to add up to 1 (100%) although if you want the controls to take up the entire field container you should do so.

ConfigOption.Name: FireChangeOnLoad
ConfigOption.Summary: Fire change event after rendering

ConfigOption.Name: Vertical
ConfigOption.Summary: True to distribute contained controls across columns, completely filling each column top to bottom before starting on the next column. The number of controls in each column will be automatically calculated to keep columns as even as possible. The default value is false, so that controls will be added to columns one at a time, completely filling each row left to right before starting on the next row.

Attribute.RawValue: True to distribute contained controls across columns, completely filling each column top to bottom before starting on the next column. The number of controls in each column will be automatically calculated to keep columns as even as possible. The default value is false, so that controls will be added to columns one at a time, completely filling each row left to right before starting on the next row.

ConfigOption.Summary: true to automatically highlight the first result gathered by the data store in the dropdown list when it is opened. (Defaults to true). A false value would cause nothing in the list to be highlighted automatically, so the user would have to manually highlight an item before pressing the enter or tab key to select it (unless the value of (typeAhead) were true), or use the mouse to select a value.

Attribute.RawValue: true to automatically highlight the first result gathered by the data store in the dropdown list when it is opened. (Defaults to true). A false value would cause nothing in the list to be highlighted automatically, so the user would have to manually highlight an item before pressing the enter or tab key to select it (unless the value of (typeAhead) were true), or use the mouse to select a value.

Class.Name: CycleButton
Class.Summary: A specialized SplitButton that contains a menu of Ext.menu.CheckItem elements. The button automatically cycles through each menu items on click, raising the button's change event (or calling the button's changeHandler function, if supplied) for the active menu items. Clicking on the arrow section of the button displays the dropdown menu just like a normal SplitButton.

Attribute.RawValue: A specialized SplitButton that contains a menu of Ext.menu.CheckItem elements. The button automatically cycles through each menu items on click, raising the button's change event (or calling the button's changeHandler function, if supplied) for the active menu items. Clicking on the arrow section of the button displays the dropdown menu just like a normal SplitButton.

ConfigOption.Name: ChangeHandler
ConfigOption.Summary: A callback function that will be invoked each time the active menu items in the button's menu has changed. If this callback is not supplied, the SplitButton will instead fire the change event on active items change. The changeHandler function will be called with the following argument list: (SplitButton this, Ext.menu.CheckItem items).

Attribute.RawValue: A callback function that will be invoked each time the active menu items in the button's menu has changed. If this callback is not supplied, the SplitButton will instead fire the change event on active items change. The changeHandler function will be called with the following argument list: (SplitButton this, Ext.menu.CheckItem items).

ConfigOption.Name: ForceIcon
ConfigOption.Summary: A css class which sets an image to be used as the static icon for this button. This icon will always be displayed regardless of which item is selected in the dropdown list. This overrides the default behavior of changing the button's icon to match the selected item's icon on change.

Attribute.RawValue: A css class which sets an image to be used as the static icon for this button. This icon will always be displayed regardless of which item is selected in the dropdown list. This overrides the default behavior of changing the button's icon to match the selected item's icon on change.

ConfigOption.Name: PrependText
ConfigOption.Summary: A static string to prepend before the active items's text when displayed as the button's text (only applies when showText = true, defaults to '')

Attribute.RawValue: A static string to prepend before the active items's text when displayed as the button's text (only applies when showText = true, defaults to '')

ConfigOption.Name: ShowText
ConfigOption.Summary: True to display the active item's text as the button text. The Button will show its configured text if this config is omitted (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to display the active item's text as the button text. The Button will show its configured text if this config is omitted (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Name: ToggleOnClick
ConfigOption.Summary: False to prevent change active item after button click (defaults to true).

Attribute.RawValue: False to prevent change active item after button click (defaults to true).

ConfigOption.Name: Listeners
ConfigOption.Summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: DirectEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side Ajax Event Handlers

Method.Name: ToggleSelected
Method.Summary: This is normally called internally on button click, but can be called externally to advance the button's active item programmatically to the next one in the menu. If the current item is the last one in the menu the active item will be set to the first item in the menu.

Attribute.RawValue: This is normally called internally on button click, but can be called externally to advance the button's active item programmatically to the next one in the menu. If the current item is the last one in the menu the active item will be set to the first item in the menu.

ConfigOption.Name: Change
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires after the button's active menu items has changed. Note that if a changeHandler function is set on this CycleButton, it will be called instead on active items change and this change event will not be fired.

Attribute.RawValue: Fires after the button's active menu items has changed. Note that if a changeHandler function is set on this CycleButton, it will be called instead on active items change and this change event will not be fired.

ConfigOption.Name: Change
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires after the button's active menu items has changed. Note that if a changeHandler function is set on this CycleButton, it will be called instead on active items change and this change event will not be fired.

ConfigOption.Name: AnyMatch
ConfigOption.Summary: True to allow any match - no regex start/end line anchors will be added. Defaults to false

ConfigOption.Name: CaseSensitive
ConfigOption.Summary: True to make the regex case sensitive (adds 'i' switch to regex). Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: True to make the regex case sensitive (adds 'i' switch to regex). Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: ExactMatch
ConfigOption.Summary: True to force exact match (^ and $ characters added to the regex). Defaults to false. Ignored if anyMatch is true.

Attribute.RawValue: True to force exact match (^ and $ characters added to the regex). Defaults to false. Ignored if anyMatch is true.

ConfigOption.Name: FilterFn
