Class.Name: DateField
Class.Summary: Provides a date input field with a DatePicker dropdown and automatic date validation.

Attribute.RawValue: Provides a date input field with a DatePicker dropdown and automatic date validation.

ConfigOption.Name: Listeners
ConfigOption.Summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: DirectEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side Ajax Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: SelectedDate
ConfigOption.Summary: Gets or sets the current selected date of the DatePicker. Accepts and returns a DateTime object.

Attribute.RawValue: Gets or sets the current selected date of the DatePicker. Accepts and returns a DateTime object.

ConfigOption.Name: SelectedValue
ConfigOption.Summary: Gets or sets the current selected date of the DatePicker.

Attribute.RawValue: Gets or sets the current selected date of the DatePicker.

ConfigOption.Name: AltFormats
ConfigOption.Summary: Multiple date formats separated by \" | \" to try when parsing a user input value and it does not match the defined format (defaults to 'm/d/Y|n/j/Y|n/j/y|m/j/y|n/d/y|m/j/Y|n/d/Y|m-d-y|m-d-Y|m/d|m-d|md|mdy|mdY|d|Y-m-d|n-j|n/j').

Attribute.RawValue: Multiple date formats separated by \" | \" to try when parsing a user input value and it does not match the defined format (defaults to 'm/d/Y|n/j/Y|n/j/y|m/j/y|n/d/y|m/j/Y|n/d/Y|m-d-y|m-d-Y|m/d|m-d|md|mdy|mdY|d|Y-m-d|n-j|n/j').

ConfigOption.Name: DisabledDates
ConfigOption.Summary: An array of \"dates\" to disable, as strings. These strings will be used to build a dynamic regular expression so they are very powerful.

Attribute.RawValue: An array of \"dates\" to disable, as strings. These strings will be used to build a dynamic regular expression so they are very powerful.

ConfigOption.Name: DisabledDatesText
ConfigOption.Summary: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date (defaults to 'Disabled').

Attribute.RawValue: The tooltip text to display when the date falls on a disabled date (defaults to 'Disabled').

ConfigOption.Name: DisabledDays
ConfigOption.Summary: An array of days to disable, 0 based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday (defaults to null).

Attribute.RawValue: An array of days to disable, 0 based. For example, [0, 6] disables Sunday and Saturday (defaults to null).

ConfigOption.Name: DisabledDaysText
ConfigOption.Summary: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day (defaults to 'Disabled').

Attribute.RawValue: The tooltip to display when the date falls on a disabled day (defaults to 'Disabled').

ConfigOption.Name: Format
ConfigOption.Summary: The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to Date.parseDate (defaults to 'd').

Attribute.RawValue: The default date format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to Date.parseDate (defaults to 'd').

ConfigOption.Name: InvalidText
ConfigOption.Summary: The error text to display when the date in the field is invalid (defaults to '{value} is not a valid date - it must be in the format {format}').

Attribute.RawValue: The error text to display when the date in the field is invalid (defaults to '{value} is not a valid date - it must be in the format {format}').

ConfigOption.Name: MaxText
ConfigOption.Summary: The error text to display when the date in the cell is after MaxValue (defaults to 'The date in this field must be before {MaxValue}').

Attribute.RawValue: The error text to display when the date in the cell is after MaxValue (defaults to 'The date in this field must be before {MaxValue}').

ConfigOption.Name: MaxDate
ConfigOption.Summary: The maximum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a valid format (defaults to undefined).

Attribute.RawValue: The maximum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a valid format (defaults to undefined).

ConfigOption.Name: MinText
ConfigOption.Summary: The error text to display when the date in the cell is before MinValue (defaults to 'The date in this field must be after {MinValue}').

Attribute.RawValue: The error text to display when the date in the cell is before MinValue (defaults to 'The date in this field must be after {MinValue}').

ConfigOption.Name: MinDate
ConfigOption.Summary: The minimum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a valid format (defaults to undefined).

Attribute.RawValue: The minimum allowed date. Can be either a Javascript date object or a string date in a valid format (defaults to undefined).

ConfigOption.Name: ShowToday
ConfigOption.Summary: False to hide the footer area of the DatePicker containing the Today button and disable the keyboard handler for spacebar that selects the current date (defaults to true).

Attribute.RawValue: False to hide the footer area of the DatePicker containing the Today button and disable the keyboard handler for spacebar that selects the current date (defaults to true).

ConfigOption.Name: DisabledDatesRE
ConfigOption.Summary: JavaScript regular expression used to disable a pattern of dates. The disabledDates config will generate this regex internally, but if you specify disabledDatesRE it will take precedence over the disabledDates value. Defaults to: null

ConfigOption.Name: TimeFormat
ConfigOption.Summary: The time display format used by the time fields. By default the DateRange uses the Extensible.Date.use24HourTime setting and sets the format to 'g:i A' for 12-hour time (e.g., 1:30 PM) or 'G:i' for 24-hour time (e.g., 13:30). This can also be overridden by a static format string if desired.

By default the DateRange uses the Extensible.Date.use24HourTime setting and sets the format to 'g:i A' for 12-hour time (e.g., 1:30 PM) or 'G:i' for 24-hour time (e.g., 13:30). This can also be overridden by a static format string if desired.

Class.Name: DD
Class.Summary: A DragDrop implementation where the linked element follows the mouse cursor during a drag.

Attribute.RawValue: A DragDrop implementation where the linked element follows the mouse cursor during a drag.

ConfigOption.Name: Scroll
ConfigOption.Summary: When set to true, the utility automatically tries to scroll the browser window when a drag and drop element is dragged near the viewport boundary. Defaults to true.

Attribute.RawValue: When set to true, the utility automatically tries to scroll the browser window when a drag and drop element is dragged near the viewport boundary. Defaults to true.

Class.Name: DDProxy
Class.Summary: A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into the document that follows the cursor during drag operations. At the time of the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.

Attribute.RawValue: A DragDrop implementation that inserts an empty, bordered div into the document that follows the cursor during drag operations. At the time of the click, the frame div is resized to the dimensions of the linked html element, and moved to the exact location of the linked element.

ConfigOption.Name: CenterFrame
ConfigOption.Summary: By default the frame is positioned exactly where the drag element is, so we use the cursor offset provided by Ext.dd.DD. Another option that works only if you do not have constraints on the obj is to have the drag frame centered around the cursor. Set centerFrame to true for this effect.

Attribute.RawValue: By default the frame is positioned exactly where the drag element is, so we use the cursor offset provided by Ext.dd.DD. Another option that works only if you do not have constraints on the obj is to have the drag frame centered around the cursor. Set centerFrame to true for this effect.

ConfigOption.Name: ResizeFrame
ConfigOption.Summary: By default we resize the drag frame to be the same size as the element we want to drag (this is to get the frame effect). We can turn it off if we want a different behavior.

Attribute.RawValue: By default we resize the drag frame to be the same size as the element we want to drag (this is to get the frame effect). We can turn it off if we want a different behavior.

ConfigOption.Summary: Abstract method runs on drag end

Attribute.RawValue: Abstract method runs on drag end

ConfigOption.Summary: Function to call when executing a request. directFn is a simple alternative to defining the api configuration-parameter for Store's which will not implement a full CRUD api.

ConfigOption.Name: ParamOrder
ConfigOption.Summary: Defaults to undefined. A list of params to be executed server side. Specify the params in the order in which they must be executed on the server-side as a String of params delimited by either whitespace, comma, or pipe.

Attribute.RawValue: Defaults to undefined. A list of params to be executed server side. Specify the params in the order in which they must be executed on the server-side as a String of params delimited by either whitespace, comma, or pipe.

ConfigOption.Name: ParamsAsHash
ConfigOption.Summary: Send parameters as a collection of named arguments (defaults to true). Providing a paramOrder nullifies this configuration.

Attribute.RawValue: Send parameters as a collection of named arguments (defaults to true). Providing a paramOrder nullifies this configuration.

Class.Name: DisplayField
Class.Summary: A display-only text field which is not validated and not submitted.

Attribute.RawValue: A display-only text field which is not validated and not submitted.

ConfigOption.Name: FieldCls
ConfigOption.Summary: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to 'x-form-display-field')

Attribute.RawValue: The default CSS class for the field (defaults to 'x-form-display-field')

ConfigOption.Name: HtmlEncode
ConfigOption.Summary: false to skip HTML-encoding the text when rendering it (defaults to false). This might be useful if you want to include tags in the field's innerHTML rather than rendering them as string literals per the default logic.

Attribute.RawValue: false to skip HTML-encoding the text when rendering it (defaults to false). This might be useful if you want to include tags in the field's innerHTML rather than rendering them as string literals per the default logic.

ConfigOption.Name: Text
ConfigOption.Summary: The plain text to display within the label (defaults to ''). If you need to include HTML tags within the label's innerHTML, use the html config instead.

Attribute.RawValue: The plain text to display within the label (defaults to ''). If you need to include HTML tags within the label's innerHTML, use the html config instead.

ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side Ajax Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: Tag
ConfigOption.Summary: The tag name of the element

Attribute.RawValue: The tag name of the element

ConfigOption.Name: ID
ConfigOption.Summary: The id of the element

ConfigOption.Name: Cls
ConfigOption.Summary: The class attribute of the element. This will end up being either the \"class\" attribute on a HTML fragment or className for a DOM node, depending on whether DomHelper is using fragments or DOM.

Attribute.RawValue: The class attribute of the element. This will end up being either the \"class\" attribute on a HTML fragment or className for a DOM node, depending on whether DomHelper is using fragments or DOM.

ConfigOption.Name: Html
ConfigOption.Summary: The innerHTML for the element

ConfigOption.Name: Children
ConfigOption.Summary: An array of the same kind of element definition objects to be created and appended. These can be nested as deep as you want.

Attribute.RawValue: An array of the same kind of element definition objects to be created and appended. These can be nested as deep as you want.

Class.Name: DragDrop
Class.Summary: Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets.

Attribute.RawValue: Defines the interface and base operation of items that that can be dragged or can be drop targets.

ConfigOption.Name: Groups
ConfigOption.Summary: The group defines a logical collection of DragDrop objects that are related. Instances only get events when interacting with other DragDrop object in the same group. This lets us define multiple groups using a single DragDrop subclass if we want.

Attribute.RawValue: The group defines a logical collection of DragDrop objects that are related. Instances only get events when interacting with other DragDrop object in the same group. This lets us define multiple groups using a single DragDrop subclass if we want.

ConfigOption.Name: HasOuterHandles
ConfigOption.Summary: By default, drags can only be initiated if the mousedown occurs in the region the linked element is. This is done in part to work around a bug in some browsers that mis-report the mousedown if the previous mouseup happened outside of the window. This property is set to true if outer handles are defined.

Attribute.RawValue: By default, drags can only be initiated if the mousedown occurs in the region the linked element is. This is done in part to work around a bug in some browsers that mis-report the mousedown if the previous mouseup happened outside of the window. This property is set to true if outer handles are defined.

ConfigOption.Name: IgnoreSelf
ConfigOption.Summary: Set to false to enable a DragDrop object to fire drag events while dragging over its own Element. Defaults to true - DragDrop objects do not by default fire drag events to themselves.

Attribute.RawValue: Set to false to enable a DragDrop object to fire drag events while dragging over its own Element. Defaults to true - DragDrop objects do not by default fire drag events to themselves.

ConfigOption.Name: InvalidHandleClasses
ConfigOption.Summary: An Array of CSS class names for elements to be considered in valid as drag handles.

Attribute.RawValue: An Array of CSS class names for elements to be considered in valid as drag handles.

ConfigOption.Name: IsTarget
ConfigOption.Summary: By default, all instances can be a drop target. This can be disabled by setting isTarget to false.

Attribute.RawValue: By default, all instances can be a drop target. This can be disabled by setting isTarget to false.

ConfigOption.Name: MaintainOffset
ConfigOption.Summary: Maintain offsets when we resetconstraints. Set to true when you want the position of the element relative to its parent to stay the same when the page changes

Attribute.RawValue: Maintain offsets when we resetconstraints. Set to true when you want the position of the element relative to its parent to stay the same when the page changes

ConfigOption.Name: MoveOnly
ConfigOption.Summary: When set to true, other DD objects in cooperating DDGroups do not receive notification events when this DD object is dragged over them. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: When set to true, other DD objects in cooperating DDGroups do not receive notification events when this DD object is dragged over them. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: Padding
ConfigOption.Summary: An Array of CSS class names for elements to be considered in valid as drag handles.

Attribute.RawValue: An Array of CSS class names for elements to be considered in valid as drag handles.

ConfigOption.Name: PrimaryButtonOnly
ConfigOption.Summary: By default the drag and drop instance will only respond to the primary button click (left button for a right-handed mouse). Set to true to allow drag and drop to start with any mouse click that is propogated by the browser

Attribute.RawValue: By default the drag and drop instance will only respond to the primary button click (left button for a right-handed mouse). Set to true to allow drag and drop to start with any mouse click that is propogated by the browser

ConfigOption.Name: XTicks
ConfigOption.Summary: Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a horizontal graduation/interval. This array is generated automatically when you define a tick interval.

Attribute.RawValue: Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a horizontal graduation/interval. This array is generated automatically when you define a tick interval.

ConfigOption.Name: YTicks
ConfigOption.Summary: Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a vertical graduation/interval. This array is generated automatically when you define a tick interval.

Attribute.RawValue: Array of pixel locations the element will snap to if we specified a vertical graduation/interval. This array is generated automatically when you define a tick interval.

ConfigOption.Name: EndDrag
ConfigOption.Summary: Fired when we are done dragging the object

Attribute.RawValue: Fired when we are done dragging the object

ConfigOption.Name: OnAvailable
ConfigOption.Summary: Override the onAvailable method to do what is needed after the initial position was determined.

Attribute.RawValue: Override the onAvailable method to do what is needed after the initial position was determined.

ConfigOption.Name: OnDrag
ConfigOption.Summary: Abstract method called during the onMouseMove event while dragging an object.

Attribute.RawValue: Abstract method called during the onMouseMove event while dragging an object.

ConfigOption.Name: OnDragDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: Abstract method called when this item is dropped on another DragDrop obj

Attribute.RawValue: Abstract method called when this item is dropped on another DragDrop obj

ConfigOption.Name: OnDragEnter
ConfigOption.Summary: Abstract method called when this element fist begins hovering over another DragDrop obj

Attribute.RawValue: Abstract method called when this element fist begins hovering over another DragDrop obj

ConfigOption.Name: OnDragOut
ConfigOption.Summary: Abstract method called when we are no longer hovering over an element

Attribute.RawValue: Abstract method called when we are no longer hovering over an element

ConfigOption.Summary: Abstract method called when this element is hovering over another DragDrop obj

Attribute.RawValue: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mousedown

ConfigOption.Summary: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mouseup

ConfigOption.Summary: Event handler that fires when a drag/drop obj gets a mouseup

Class.Name: DragSource
Class.Summary: A simple class that provides the basic implementation needed to make any element draggable.

Attribute.RawValue: A simple class that provides the basic implementation needed to make any element draggable.

ConfigOption.Name: Group
ConfigOption.Summary: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group (defaults to undefined).

Attribute.RawValue: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group (defaults to undefined).

ConfigOption.Name: DropAllowed
ConfigOption.Summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to \"x-dd-drop-ok\").

ConfigOption.Summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to \"x-dd-drop-nodrop\").

ConfigOption.Name: AfterDragDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after a valid drag drop has occurred by providing an implementation.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after a valid drag drop has occurred by providing an implementation.

ConfigOption.Name: AfterDragEnter
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action when the dragged item enters the drop target by providing an implementation.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action when the dragged item enters the drop target by providing an implementation.

ConfigOption.Name: AfterDragOut
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after the dragged item is dragged out of the target without dropping.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after the dragged item is dragged out of the target without dropping.

ConfigOption.Name: AfterDragOver
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action while the dragged item is over the drop target by providing an implementation.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action while the dragged item is over the drop target by providing an implementation.

ConfigOption.Name: AfterInvalidDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after an invalid drop has occurred by providing an implementation.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after an invalid drop has occurred by providing an implementation.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeDragDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item is dropped onto the target and optionally cancel the onDragDrop.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item is dropped onto the target and optionally cancel the onDragDrop.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeDragEnter
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item enters the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragEnter.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item enters the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragEnter.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeDragOut
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item is dragged out of the target without dropping, and optionally cancel the onDragOut.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the dragged item is dragged out of the target without dropping, and optionally cancel the onDragOut.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeDragOver
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action while the dragged item is over the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragOver.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action while the dragged item is over the drop target and optionally cancel the onDragOver.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeInvalidDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after an invalid drop has occurred.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action after an invalid drop has occurred.

ConfigOption.Name: OnBeforeDrag
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the initial drag event begins and optionally cancel it.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action before the initial drag event begins and optionally cancel it.

ConfigOption.Name: OnStartDrag
ConfigOption.Summary: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action once the initial drag event has begun. The drag cannot be canceled from this function.

Attribute.RawValue: An empty function by default, but provided so that you can perform a custom action once the initial drag event has begun. The drag cannot be canceled from this function.

ConfigOption.Name: GetDragData
ConfigOption.Summary: Returns the data object associated with this drag source.

Attribute.RawValue: Returns the data object associated with this drag source.

ConfigOption.Name: TrackOver
ConfigOption.Summary: Set to true to fire mouseover and mouseout events when the mouse enters or leaves the target element.

Attribute.RawValue: Set to true to fire mouseover and mouseout events when the mouse enters or leaves the target element.

ConfigOption.Name: Tolerance
ConfigOption.Summary: Number of pixels the drag target must be moved before dragging is considered to have started. Defaults to 5.

Attribute.RawValue: Number of pixels the drag target must be moved before dragging is considered to have started. Defaults to 5.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoStart
ConfigOption.Summary: Defaults to 0. Specify a Number for the number of milliseconds to defer trigger start.

Attribute.RawValue: Defaults to 0. Specify a Number for the number of milliseconds to defer trigger start.

ConfigOption.Name: ProxyCls
ConfigOption.Summary: Proxy class

ConfigOption.Name: OverCls
ConfigOption.Summary: A CSS class to add to the DragTracker's target element when the element (or, if the delegate option is used, when a delegate element) is mouseovered.

Attribute.RawValue: A CSS class to add to the DragTracker's target element when the element (or, if the delegate option is used, when a delegate element) is mouseovered.

ConfigOption.Name: ConstrainTo
ConfigOption.Summary: An element which is used to constrain the result of the getOffset call.

Attribute.RawValue: An element which is used to constrain the result of the getOffset call.

ConfigOption.Name: PreventDefault
ConfigOption.Summary: Specify false to enable default actions on onMouseDown events. Defaults to true.

Attribute.RawValue: Specify false to enable default actions on onMouseDown events. Defaults to true.

ConfigOption.Name: StopEvent
ConfigOption.Summary: Specify true to stop the mousedown event from bubbling to outer listeners from the target element (or its delegates). Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: Specify true to stop the mousedown event from bubbling to outer listeners from the target element (or its delegates). Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: Target
ConfigOption.Summary: ID of the element that is linked to this instance

Attribute.RawValue: ID of the element that is linked to this instance

ConfigOption.Name: Listeners
ConfigOption.Summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: DirectEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side DirectEventHandlers

Class.Name: DragZone
Class.Summary: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dragging of multiple child source nodes.

Attribute.RawValue: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dragging of multiple child source nodes.

ConfigOption.Name: ContainerScroll
ConfigOption.Summary: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations.

Attribute.RawValue: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations.

ConfigOption.Name: HighlightingColor
ConfigOption.Summary: The color to use when visually highlighting the drag source in the afterRepair method after a failed drop (defaults to \"c3daf9\" - light blue)

Attribute.RawValue: The color to use when visually highlighting the drag source in the afterRepair method after a failed drop (defaults to \"c3daf9\" - light blue)

ConfigOption.Name: AfterRepair
ConfigOption.Summary: Called after a repair of an invalid drop. By default, highlights this.dragData.ddel

Attribute.RawValue: Called after a repair of an invalid drop. By default, highlights this.dragData.ddel

ConfigOption.Name: GetRepairXY
ConfigOption.Summary: Called before a repair of an invalid drop to get the XY to animate to. By default returns the XY of this.dragData.ddel

Attribute.RawValue: Called before a repair of an invalid drop to get the XY to animate to. By default returns the XY of this.dragData.ddel

ConfigOption.Name: OnInitDrag
ConfigOption.Summary: Called once drag threshold has been reached to initialize the proxy element. By default, it clones the this.dragData.ddel

Attribute.RawValue: Called once drag threshold has been reached to initialize the proxy element. By default, it clones the this.dragData.ddel

ConfigOption.Name: Fill
ConfigOption.Summary: The fill color

ConfigOption.Name: Image
ConfigOption.Summary: The background image

ConfigOption.Name: Listeners
ConfigOption.Summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: DirectEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side DirectEventHandlers

ConfigOption.Name: Listeners
ConfigOption.Summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: DirectEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side Ajax Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: Text
ConfigOption.Summary: The Text value to initialize this field with.

Attribute.RawValue: The Text value to initialize this field with.

ConfigOption.Name: UnderlyingValue
ConfigOption.Summary: The underlying value which mapping on the Text, similar the Value property but can be set declarative

Attribute.RawValue: The underlying value which mapping on the Text, similar the Value property but can be set declarative

ConfigOption.Name: AllowBlur
ConfigOption.Summary: False to hide the component when the field is blurred. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: False to hide the component when the field is blurred. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: ComponentRenderTo
ConfigOption.Summary: The id of the node, a DOM node or an existing Element that will be the content Container to render this component into.

Attribute.RawValue: The id of the node, a DOM node or an existing Element that will be the content Container to render this component into.

ConfigOption.Name: SyncValue
ConfigOption.Summary: Function to syncronize value of the field and dropdown control

Attribute.RawValue: Function to syncronize value of the field and dropdown control

Class.Name: DropTarget
Class.Summary: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dragging of multiple child source nodes.

Attribute.RawValue: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dragging of multiple child source nodes.

ConfigOption.Name: Group
ConfigOption.Summary: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group (defaults to undefined).

Attribute.RawValue: A named drag drop group to which this object belongs. If a group is specified, then this object will only interact with other drag drop objects in the same group (defaults to undefined).

ConfigOption.Name: DropAllowed
ConfigOption.Summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to \"x-dd-drop-ok\").

Attribute.RawValue: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is allowed (defaults to \"x-dd-drop-ok\").

ConfigOption.Name: DropNotAllowed
ConfigOption.Summary: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to \"x-dd-drop-nodrop\").

Attribute.RawValue: The CSS class returned to the drag source when drop is not allowed (defaults to \"x-dd-drop-nodrop\").

ConfigOption.Name: OverClass
ConfigOption.Summary: The CSS class applied to the drop target element while the drag source is over it (defaults to \"\").

Attribute.RawValue: The CSS class applied to the drop target element while the drag source is over it (defaults to \"\").

ConfigOption.Name: ContainerScroll
ConfigOption.Summary: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations.

Attribute.RawValue: True to register this container with the Scrollmanager for auto scrolling during drag operations.

ConfigOption.Name: NotifyDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the dragged item has been dropped on it. This method has no default implementation and returns false, so you must provide an implementation that does something to process the drop event and returns true so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

Attribute.RawValue: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the dragged item has been dropped on it. This method has no default implementation and returns false, so you must provide an implementation that does something to process the drop event and returns true so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

ConfigOption.Name: NotifyEnter
ConfigOption.Summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the source is now over the target. This default implementation adds the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) to the drop element and returns the dropAllowed config value. This method should be overridden if drop validation is required.

Attribute.RawValue: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the source is now over the target. This default implementation adds the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) to the drop element and returns the dropAllowed config value. This method should be overridden if drop validation is required.

ConfigOption.Name: NotifyOut
ConfigOption.Summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the source has been dragged out of the target without dropping. This default implementation simply removes the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) from the drop element.

Attribute.RawValue: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls once to notify this drop target that the source has been dragged out of the target without dropping. This default implementation simply removes the CSS class specified by overClass (if any) from the drop element.

ConfigOption.Name: NotifyOver
ConfigOption.Summary: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls continuously while it is being dragged over the target. This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop target. This default implementation simply returns the dropAllowed config value.

Attribute.RawValue: The function a Ext.dd.DragSource calls continuously while it is being dragged over the target. This method will be called on every mouse movement while the drag source is over the drop target. This default implementation simply returns the dropAllowed config value.

Class.Name: DropZone
Class.Summary: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dropping on multiple child target nodes.

Attribute.RawValue: This class provides a container DD instance that allows dropping on multiple child target nodes.

ConfigOption.Name: GetTargetFromEvent
ConfigOption.Summary: Returns a custom data object associated with the DOM node that is the target of the event. By default this looks up the event target in the Ext.dd.Registry, although you can override this method to provide your own custom lookup.

Attribute.RawValue: Returns a custom data object associated with the DOM node that is the target of the event. By default this looks up the event target in the Ext.dd.Registry, although you can override this method to provide your own custom lookup.

ConfigOption.Name: OnContainerDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dropped on it, but not on any of its registered drop nodes. The default implementation returns false, so it should be overridden to provide the appropriate processing of the drop event if you need the drop zone itself to be able to accept drops. It should return true when valid so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

Attribute.RawValue: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dropped on it, but not on any of its registered drop nodes. The default implementation returns false, so it should be overridden to provide the appropriate processing of the drop event if you need the drop zone itself to be able to accept drops. It should return true when valid so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

ConfigOption.Name: OnContainerOver
ConfigOption.Summary: Called while the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource is being dragged over it, but not over any of its registered drop nodes. The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so it should be overridden to provide the proper feedback if necessary.

Attribute.RawValue: Called while the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource is being dragged over it, but not over any of its registered drop nodes. The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so it should be overridden to provide the proper feedback if necessary.

ConfigOption.Name: OnNodeDrop
ConfigOption.Summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dropped onto the drop node. The default implementation returns false, so it should be overridden to provide the appropriate processing of the drop event and return true so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

Attribute.RawValue: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dropped onto the drop node. The default implementation returns false, so it should be overridden to provide the appropriate processing of the drop event and return true so that the drag source's repair action does not run.

ConfigOption.Name: OnNodeEnter
ConfigOption.Summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has entered a drop node that has either been registered or detected by a configured implementation of getTargetFromEvent. This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide node-specific processing if necessary.

Attribute.RawValue: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has entered a drop node that has either been registered or detected by a configured implementation of getTargetFromEvent. This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide node-specific processing if necessary.

ConfigOption.Name: OnNodeOut
ConfigOption.Summary: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dragged out of the drop node without dropping. This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide node-specific processing if necessary.

Attribute.RawValue: Called when the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource has been dragged out of the drop node without dropping. This method has no default implementation and should be overridden to provide node-specific processing if necessary.

ConfigOption.Name: OnNodeOver
ConfigOption.Summary: Called while the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource is over a drop node that has either been registered or detected by a configured implementation of getTargetFromEvent. The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so it should be overridden to provide the proper feedback.

Attribute.RawValue: Called while the DropZone determines that a Ext.dd.DragSource is over a drop node that has either been registered or detected by a configured implementation of getTargetFromEvent. The default implementation returns this.dropNotAllowed, so it should be overridden to provide the proper feedback.

Class.Name: Editor
Class.Summary: The Editor class is used to provide inline editing for elements on the page. The editor is backed by a Ext.form.field.Field that will be displayed to edit the underlying content. The editor is a floating Component, when the editor is shown it is automatically aligned to display over the top of the bound element it is editing.

Attribute.RawValue: The Editor class is used to provide inline editing for elements on the page. The editor is backed by a Ext.form.field.Field that will be displayed to edit the underlying content. The editor is a floating Component, when the editor is shown it is automatically aligned to display over the top of the bound element it is editing.

ConfigOption.Name: ActivateEvent
ConfigOption.Summary: Event name for activate the editor

Attribute.RawValue: Event name for activate the editor

ConfigOption.Name: Alignment
ConfigOption.Summary: The position to align to (see Ext.Element.alignTo for more details, defaults to \"c-c?\").

Attribute.RawValue: The position to align to (see Ext.Element.alignTo for more details, defaults to \"c-c?\").

ConfigOption.Name: AlignmentConfig
ConfigOption.Summary: The position to align to (see Ext.Element.alignTo for more details, defaults to \"c-c?\").

Attribute.RawValue: The position to align to (see Ext.Element.alignTo for more details, defaults to \"c-c?\").

ConfigOption.Name: AutoSize
ConfigOption.Summary: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

Attribute.RawValue: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoSizeConfig
ConfigOption.Summary: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

Attribute.RawValue: True for the editor to automatically adopt the size of the underlying field. Otherwise, an object can be passed to indicate where to get each dimension. The available properties are 'boundEl' and 'field'. If a dimension is not specified, it will use the underlying height/width specified on the editor object.

ConfigOption.Name: AllowBlur
ConfigOption.Summary: True to complete the editing process if in edit mode when the field is blurred. Defaults to true.

Attribute.RawValue: True to complete the editing process if in edit mode when the field is blurred. Defaults to true.

ConfigOption.Name: CancelOnBlur
ConfigOption.Summary: True to cancel the edit when the blur event is fired (defaults to false)

Attribute.RawValue: True to cancel the edit when the blur event is fired (defaults to false)

ConfigOption.Name: CancelOnEsc
ConfigOption.Summary: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed. Defaults to: true

Attribute.RawValue: True to cancel the edit when the escape key is pressed. Defaults to: true

ConfigOption.Name: CompleteOnEnter
ConfigOption.Summary: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

Attribute.RawValue: True to complete the edit when the enter key is pressed (defaults to false)

ConfigOption.Name: Constrain
ConfigOption.Summary: True to constrain the editor to the viewport. Defaults to: false

Attribute.RawValue: True to constrain the editor to the viewport. Defaults to: false

ConfigOption.Name: HideEl
ConfigOption.Summary: False to keep the bound element visible while the editor is displayed. Defaults to: true

Attribute.RawValue: False to keep the bound element visible while the editor is displayed. Defaults to: true

ConfigOption.Name: Field
ConfigOption.Summary: The Field object (or descendant)

ConfigOption.Name: IgnoreNoChange
ConfigOption.Summary: True to skip the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and the value has not changed. Applies only to string values - edits for other data types will never be ignored. Defaults to: false

Attribute.RawValue: True to skip the edit completion process (no save, no events fired) if the user completes an edit and the value has not changed. Applies only to string values - edits for other data types will never be ignored. Defaults to: false

ConfigOption.Name: Offsets
ConfigOption.Summary: The offsets to use when aligning. Defaults to [0, 0].

Attribute.RawValue: The offsets to use when aligning. Defaults to [0, 0].

ConfigOption.Name: ParentElement
ConfigOption.Summary: An element to render to. Defaults to the document.body.

Attribute.RawValue: An element to render to. Defaults to the document.body.

ConfigOption.Name: RevertInvalid
ConfigOption.Summary: True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field validation fails (defaults to true)

Attribute.RawValue: True to automatically revert the field value and cancel the edit when the user completes an edit and the field validation fails (defaults to true)

ConfigOption.Name: ShadowMode
ConfigOption.Summary: \"sides\" for sides/bottom only, \"frame\" for 4-way shadow, and \"drop\" for bottom-right shadow (defaults to \"frame\")

Attribute.RawValue: \"sides\" for sides/bottom only, \"frame\" for 4-way shadow, and \"drop\" for bottom-right shadow (defaults to \"frame\")

ConfigOption.Name: SwallowKeys
ConfigOption.Summary: Handle the keydown/keypress events so they don't propagate (defaults to true)

Attribute.RawValue: Handle the keydown/keypress events so they don't propagate (defaults to true)

ConfigOption.Name: UpdateEl
ConfigOption.Summary: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes (defaults to false)

Attribute.RawValue: True to update the innerHTML of the bound element when the update completes (defaults to false)

ConfigOption.Name: Value
ConfigOption.Summary: The data value of the underlying field (defaults to \"\")

Attribute.RawValue: The data value of the underlying field (defaults to \"\")

ConfigOption.Name: Target
ConfigOption.Summary: The target id to associate with this tooltip.

Attribute.RawValue: The target id to associate with this tooltip.

ConfigOption.Name: Listeners
ConfigOption.Summary: Client-side JavaScript Event Handlers

ConfigOption.Name: DirectEvents
ConfigOption.Summary: Server-side DirectEventHandlers

Method.Name: StartEdit
Method.Summary: Starts the editing process and shows the editor.

Attribute.RawValue: Starts the editing process and shows the editor.

Method.Name: StartEdit
Method.Summary: Starts the editing process and shows the editor.

Attribute.RawValue: Starts the editing process and shows the editor.

ConfigOption.Name: Callback
ConfigOption.Summary: A function called when the effect is finished. Note that effects are queued internally by the Fx class, so do not need to use the callback parameter to specify another effect -- effects can simply be chained together and called in sequence (e.g., el.slideIn().highlight();). The callback is intended for any additional code that should run once a particular effect has completed. The Element being operated upon is passed as the first parameter.

Attribute.RawValue: A function called when the effect is finished. Note that effects are queued internally by the Fx class, so do not need to use the callback parameter to specify another effect -- effects can simply be chained together and called in sequence (e.g., el.slideIn().highlight();). The callback is intended for any additional code that should run once a particular effect has completed. The Element being operated upon is passed as the first parameter.

ConfigOption.Name: Duration
ConfigOption.Summary: The length of time (in seconds) that the effect should last

Attribute.RawValue: The length of time (in seconds) that the effect should last

ConfigOption.Name: Easing
ConfigOption.Summary: A valid Easing value for the effect

Attribute.RawValue: A valid Easing value for the effect

ConfigOption.Name: Scope
ConfigOption.Summary: The scope of the effect function

Attribute.RawValue: The scope of the effect function

ConfigOption.Name: PollInterval
ConfigOption.Summary: Interval in milliseconds at which the form's fields are checked for value changes. Only used if the pollForChanges option is set to true. Defaults to 500 milliseconds.

Attribute.RawValue: Interval in milliseconds at which the form's fields are checked for value changes. Only used if the pollForChanges option is set to true. Defaults to 500 milliseconds.

ConfigOption.Name: PollForChanges
ConfigOption.Summary: If set to true, sets up an interval task (using the pollInterval) in which the panel's fields are repeatedly checked for changes in their values. This is in addition to the normal detection each field does on its own input element, and is not needed in most cases. It does, however, provide a means to absolutely guarantee detection of all changes including some edge cases in some browsers which do not fire native events. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: If set to true, sets up an interval task (using the pollInterval) in which the panel's fields are repeatedly checked for changes in their values. This is in addition to the normal detection each field does on its own input element, and is not needed in most cases. It does, however, provide a means to absolutely guarantee detection of all changes including some edge cases in some browsers which do not fire native events. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: BeforeComplete
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires after a change has been made to the field, but before the change is reflected in the underlying field. Saving the change to the field can be canceled by returning false from the handler of this event. Note that if the value has not changed and ignoreNoChange = true, the editing will still end but this event will not fire since no edit actually occurred.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoAppendParams

Attribute.RawValue: True to automatically append the request's params to the generated url. Defaults to true

ConfigOption.Name: CallbackKey
ConfigOption.Summary: Specifies the GET parameter that will be sent to the server containing the function name to be executed when the request completes. Defaults to callback. Thus, a common request will be in the form of url?callback=Ext.data.JsonP.callback1

Attribute.RawValue: Specifies the GET parameter that will be sent to the server containing the function name to be executed when the request completes. Defaults to callback. Thus, a common request will be in the form of url?callback=Ext.data.JsonP.callback1

ConfigOption.Name: RecordParam
ConfigOption.Summary: The param name to use when passing records to the server (e.g. 'records=someEncodedRecordString'). Defaults to 'records'

Attribute.RawValue: The param name to use when passing records to the server (e.g. 'records=someEncodedRecordString'). Defaults to 'records'

ConfigOption.Name: Record
ConfigOption.Summary: The optional location within the JSON response that the record data itself can be found at. See the JsonReader intro docs for more details. This is not often needed and defaults to undefined.

Attribute.RawValue: The optional location within the JSON response that the record data itself can be found at. See the JsonReader intro docs for more details. This is not often needed and defaults to undefined.

ConfigOption.Name: UseSimpleAccessors
ConfigOption.Summary: True to ensure that field names/mappings are treated as literals when reading values. Defalts to false. For example, by default, using the mapping \"foo.bar.baz\" will try and read a property foo from the root, then a property bar from foo, then a property baz from bar. Setting the simple accessors to true will read the property with the name \"foo.bar.baz\" direct from the root object.

Attribute.RawValue: True to ensure that field names/mappings are treated as literals when reading values. Defalts to false. For example, by default, using the mapping \"foo.bar.baz\" will try and read a property foo from the root, then a property bar from foo, then a property baz from bar. Setting the simple accessors to true will read the property with the name \"foo.bar.baz\" direct from the root object.

ConfigOption.Name: Root

ConfigOption.Name: Encode

ConfigOption.Name: AllowSingle

Attribute.RawValue: Provides a convenient wrapper for normalized keyboard navigation. KeyNav allows you to bind navigation keys to function calls that will get called when the keys are pressed, providing an easy way to implement custom navigation schemes for any UI component.

ConfigOption.Summary: Handle the keydown event instead of keypress (defaults to false). KeyNav automatically does this for IE since IE does not propagate special keys on keypress, but setting this to true will force other browsers to also handle keydown instead of keypress.

Attribute.RawValue: Produces a standalone <label /> element which can be inserted into a form and be associated with a field in that form using the forId property.

ConfigOption.Name: Format
ConfigOption.Summary: The format of the string to render using the .Text property. Example 'Hello {0}'.

Attribute.RawValue: The format of the string to render using the .Text property. Example 'Hello {0}'.

ConfigOption.Name: EmptyText
ConfigOption.Summary: The default text to display if the Text property is empty (defaults to '').

Attribute.RawValue: The default text to display if the Text property is empty (defaults to '').

ConfigOption.Name: ForID
ConfigOption.Summary: The id of the input element to which this label will be bound via the standard HTML 'for' attribute. If not specified, the attribute will not be added to the label. In most cases you will be associating the label with a Ext.form.field.Base component, so you should make sure this matches the inputId of that field.

Attribute.RawValue: The id of the input element to which this label will be bound via the standard HTML 'for' attribute. If not specified, the attribute will not be added to the label. In most cases you will be associating the label with a Ext.form.field.Base component, so you should make sure this matches the inputId of that field.

ConfigOption.Name: Html

Attribute.RawValue: An HTML fragment that will be used as the label's innerHTML (defaults to ''). Note that if text is specified it will take precedence and this value will be ignored.

Attribute.RawValue: The plain text to display within the label (defaults to ''). If you need to include HTML tags within the label's innerHTML, use the html config instead.

Class.Name: LoadMask
Class.Summary: A simple utility class for generically masking elements while loading data. If the element being masked has an underlying Ext.data.Store, the masking will be automatically synchronized with the store's loading process and the mask element will be cached for reuse. For all other elements, this mask will replace the element's UpdateOptions load indicator and will be destroyed after the initial load.

Attribute.RawValue: A simple utility class for generically masking elements while loading data. If the element being masked has an underlying Ext.data.Store, the masking will be automatically synchronized with the store's loading process and the mask element will be cached for reuse. For all other elements, this mask will replace the element's UpdateOptions load indicator and will be destroyed after the initial load.

ConfigOption.Name: ShowMask

ConfigOption.Name: DayClick
ConfigOption.Summary: Fires after the user clicks within the view container and not on an event element. This is a cancelable event, so returning false from a handler will cancel the click without displaying the event editor view. This could be useful for validating that a user can only create events on certain days.

Attribute.RawValue: 1, "dt", typeof(DateTime), "The date/time that was clicked on"
2, "allDay", typeof(bool), "True if the day clicked on represents an all-day box, else false. Clicks within the MonthView always return true for this param."
3, "el", typeof(Element), "The Element that was clicked on"

Class.Name: NumberField
Class.Summary: A numeric text field that provides automatic keystroke filtering to disallow non-numeric characters, and numeric validation to limit the value to a range of valid numbers. The range of acceptable number values can be controlled by setting the minValue and maxValue configs, and fractional decimals can be disallowed by setting allowDecimals to false.

Attribute.RawValue: A numeric text field that provides automatic keystroke filtering to disallow non-numeric characters, and numeric validation to limit the value to a range of valid numbers. ConfigOption.Name: NegativeText

Attribute.RawValue: Error text to display if the value is negative and minValue is set to 0. This is used instead of the minText in that circumstance only.

ConfigOption.Name: DisplayMsg
ConfigOption.Summary: The paging status message to display. Note that this string is formatted using the braced numbers {0}-{2} as tokens that are replaced by the values for start, end and total respectively. These tokens should be preserved when overriding this string if showing those values is desired. Defaults to: \"Displaying {0} - {1} of {2}\"

Attribute.RawValue: The paging status message to display. Note that this string is formatted using the braced numbers {0}-{2} as tokens that are replaced by the values for start, end and total respectively. Class.Name: Shift
Class.Summary: Animates the transition of any combination of an element's dimensions, xy position and/or opacity. Any of these properties not specified in the config object will not be changed. This effect requires that at least one new dimension, position or opacity setting must be passed in on the config object in order for the function to have any effect.

Attribute.RawValue: Animates the transition of any combination of an element's dimensions, xy position and/or opacity. Any of these properties not specified in the config object will not be changed. This effect requires that at least one new dimension, position or opacity setting must be passed in on the config object in order for the function to have any effect.

Class.Name: SlideIn
Class.Summary: Slides the element into view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the point of origin for the slide effect. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

Attribute.RawValue: Slides the element into view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the point of origin for the slide effect. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

Class.Name: SlideOut
Class.Summary: Slides the element out of view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the end point for the slide effect. When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

Attribute.RawValue: Slides the element out of view. An anchor point can be optionally passed to set the end point for the slide effect. When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired. This function automatically handles wrapping the element with a fixed-size container if needed.

Class.Name: StatusBar
Class.Summary: Basic status bar component that can be used as the bottom toolbar of any Ext.Panel.

Attribute.RawValue: Basic status bar component that can be used as the bottom toolbar of any Ext.Panel.

ConfigOption.Name: AutoClear
ConfigOption.Summary: The number of milliseconds to wait after setting the status via setStatus before automatically clearing the status text and icon (defaults to 5000). Note that this only applies when passing the clear argument to setStatus since that is the only way to defer clearing the status. This can be overridden by specifying a different wait value in setStatus. Calls to clearStatus always clear the status bar immediately and ignore this value.

Attribute.RawValue: The number of milliseconds to wait after setting the status via setStatus before automatically clearing the status text and icon (defaults to 5000). Note that this only applies when passing the clear argument to setStatus since that is the only way to defer clearing the status. This can be overridden by specifying a different wait value in setStatus. Calls to clearStatus always clear the status bar immediately and ignore this value.

ConfigOption.Name: BusyIcon
ConfigOption.Summary: The default Icon applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'Icon.None'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the iconCls argument into showBusy. See the Icon or IconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon.

Attribute.RawValue: The default Icon applied when calling showBusy (defaults to 'Icon.None'). It can be overridden at any time by passing the iconCls argument into showBusy. See the Icon or IconCls docs for additional details about customizing the icon.

Attribute.RawValue: The default text value. This will be used anytime the status bar is cleared with the useDefaults:true option (defaults to '').

ConfigOption.Name: Icon
ConfigOption.Summary: An Icon that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to 'Icon.None'). The Icons is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

Attribute.RawValue: An Icon that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to 'Icon.None'). The Icons is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

ConfigOption.Name: IconCls
ConfigOption.Summary: A CSS class that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to ''). The class is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

Attribute.RawValue: A CSS class that will be applied to the status element and is expected to provide a background image that will serve as the status bar icon (defaults to ''). The class is applied directly to the div that also contains the status text, so the rule should provide the appropriate padding on the div to make room for the image.

ConfigOption.Name: StatusAlign
ConfigOption.Summary: The alignment of the status element within the overall StatusBar layout. When the StatusBar is rendered, it creates an internal div containing the status text and icon. Any additional Toolbar items added in the StatusBar's items config, or added via add or any of the supported add* methods, will be rendered, in added order, to the opposite side. The status element is greedy, so it will automatically expand to take up all sapce left over by any other items.

Attribute.RawValue: The alignment of the status element within the overall StatusBar layout. When the StatusBar is rendered, it creates an internal div containing the status text and icon. Any additional Toolbar items added in the StatusBar's items config, or added via add or any of the supported add* methods, will be rendered, in added order, to the opposite side. The status element is greedy, so it will automatically expand to take up all sapce left over by any other items.

ConfigOption.Name: ClearOnPageLoad
ConfigOption.Summary: True to empty the store when loading another page via loadPage, nextPage or previousPage (defaults to true). Setting to false keeps existing records, allowing large data sets to be loaded one page at a time but rendered all together.

Attribute.RawValue: True to empty the store when loading another page via loadPage, nextPage or previousPage (defaults to true). Setting to false keeps existing records, allowing large data sets to be loaded one page at a time but rendered all together.

ConfigOption.Name: PurgePageCount
ConfigOption.Summary: The number of pages to keep in the cache before purging additional records. A value of 0 indicates to never purge the prefetched data. This option is only relevant when the buffered option is set to true.

Attribute.RawValue: The number of pages to keep in the cache before purging additional records. A value of 0 indicates to never purge the prefetched data. This option is only relevant when the buffered option is set to true.

ConfigOption.Name: RemoteFilter
ConfigOption.Summary: True to defer any filtering operation to the server. If false, filtering is done locally on the client. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: True to defer any filtering operation to the server. If false, filtering is done locally on the client. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: RemoteGroup
ConfigOption.Summary: True if the grouping should apply on the server side, false if it is local only (defaults to false). If the grouping is local, it can be applied immediately to the data. If it is remote, then it will simply act as a helper, automatically sending the grouping information to the server.

Attribute.RawValue: True if the grouping should apply on the server side, false if it is local only (defaults to false). If the grouping is local, it can be applied immediately to the data. If it is remote, then it will simply act as a helper, automatically sending the grouping information to the server.

ConfigOption.Name: RemoteSort
ConfigOption.Summary: True to defer any sorting operation to the server. If false, sorting is done locally on the client. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: True to defer any sorting operation to the server. If false, sorting is done locally on the client. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: RemotePaging
ConfigOption.Summary: True to perform remote paging.

ConfigOption.Name: IsPagingStore
ConfigOption.Summary: True to use PagingStore instance

ConfigOption.Name: SortOnFilter
ConfigOption.Summary: For local filtering only, causes sort to be called whenever filter is called, causing the sorters to be reapplied after filtering. Defaults to true

Attribute.RawValue: For local filtering only, causes sort to be called whenever filter is called, causing the sorters to be reapplied after filtering. Defaults to true

ConfigOption.Name: GroupDir
ConfigOption.Summary: The direction in which sorting should be applied when grouping. Defaults to \"ASC\" - the other supported value is \"DESC\"

Attribute.RawValue: The direction in which sorting should be applied when grouping. Defaults to \"ASC\" - the other supported value is \"DESC\"

ConfigOption.Name: GroupField
ConfigOption.Summary: The (optional) field by which to group data in the store. Internally, grouping is very similar to sorting - the groupField and groupDir are injected as the first sorter (see sort). Stores support a single level of grouping, and groups can be fetched via the getGroups method.

Attribute.RawValue: The (optional) field by which to group data in the store. Internally, grouping is very similar to sorting - the groupField and groupDir are injected as the first sorter (see sort). Stores support a single level of grouping, and groups can be fetched via the getGroups method.

ConfigOption.Name: Groupers
ConfigOption.Summary: The collection of groupers currently applied to this Store

Attribute.RawValue: The collection of groupers currently applied to this Store

ConfigOption.Name: PageSize
ConfigOption.Summary: The number of records considered to form a 'page'. This is used to power the built-in paging using the nextPage and previousPage functions. Defaults to 25.

Attribute.RawValue: The number of records considered to form a 'page'. This is used to power the built-in paging using the nextPage and previousPage functions. Defaults to 25.

ConfigOption.Name: WarningOnDirty
ConfigOption.Summary: If true show a warning before load/reload if store has dirty data

Attribute.RawValue: If true show a warning before load/reload if store has dirty data

ConfigOption.Name: DirtyWarningTitle
ConfigOption.Summary: The title of window showing before load if the dirty data exists

Attribute.RawValue: The title of window showing before load if the dirty data exists

ConfigOption.Name: DirtyWarningText
ConfigOption.DefaultValue: "You have uncommitted changes. Are you sure you want to load/reload data?"
ConfigOption.Summary: The text of window showing before load if the dirty data exists

Attribute.RawValue: "You have uncommitted changes. Are you sure you want to load/reload data?"
The text of window showing before load if the dirty data exists

ConfigOption.Name: IgnoreExtraFields
ConfigOption.Summary: If true then only properties included to reader will be converted to json

Attribute.RawValue: If true then only properties included to reader will be converted to json

ConfigOption.Name: Reader
ConfigOption.Summary: The Ext.data.reader.Reader to use to decode the server's response. This can either be a Reader instance, a config object or just a valid Reader type name (e.g. 'json', 'xml').

Attribute.RawValue: The Ext.data.reader.Reader to use to decode the server's response. This can either be a Reader instance, a config object or just a valid Reader type name (e.g. 'json', 'xml').

ConfigOption.Name: Writer
ConfigOption.Summary: The Ext.data.writer.Writer to use to encode any request sent to the server. This can either be a Writer instance, a config object or just a valid Writer type name (e.g. 'json', 'xml').

Attribute.RawValue: The Ext.data.writer.Writer to use to encode any request sent to the server. This can either be a Writer instance, a config object or just a valid Writer type name (e.g. 'json', 'xml').

Class.Name: SwitchOff
Class.Summary: Blinks the element as if it was clicked and then collapses on its center (similar to switching off a television). When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired.

Attribute.RawValue: Blinks the element as if it was clicked and then collapses on its center (similar to switching off a television). When the effect is completed, the element will be hidden (visibility = 'hidden') but block elements will still take up space in the document. The element must be removed from the DOM using the 'remove' config option if desired.

ConfigOption.Name: ActionItemID
ConfigOption.Summary: Managed container id. It will be shown when tab is activated

Attribute.RawValue: Managed container id. It will be shown when tab is activated

ConfigOption.Name: ActionItem
ConfigOption.Summary: Managed container. It will be shown when tab is activated

Attribute.RawValue: Managed container. It will be shown when tab is activated

ConfigOption.Name: HideMode
ConfigOption.Summary: How the action item. Supported values are 'visibility' (css visibility), 'offsets' (negative offset position) and 'display' (css display).

Attribute.RawValue: How the action item. Supported values are 'visibility' (css visibility), 'offsets' (negative offset position) and 'display' (css display).

ConfigOption.Name: ToolTip
ConfigOption.Summary: The tooltip for the button - can be a string to be used as innerHTML (html tags are accepted).

Attribute.RawValue: The tooltip for the button - can be a string to be used as innerHTML (html tags are accepted).

ConfigOption.Name: Closable
ConfigOption.Summary: Panels themselves do not directly support being closed, but some Panel subclasses do (like Ext.Window) or a Panel Class within an Ext.TabPanel. Specify true to enable closing in such situations. Defaults to false.

Attribute.RawValue: Panels themselves do not directly support being closed, but some Panel subclasses do (like Ext.Window) or a Panel Class within an Ext.TabPanel. Specify true to enable closing in such situations. Defaults to false.

ConfigOption.Name: Hidden
ConfigOption.Summary: Render this component hidden (default is false). If true, the hide method will be called internally.

Attribute.RawValue: Render this component hidden (default is false). If true, the hide method will be called internally.

ConfigOption.Name: Disabled
ConfigOption.Summary: True to disable the tab.

ConfigOption.Name: Icon
ConfigOption.Summary: The icon to use in the Button. See also, IconCls to set an icon with a custom Css class.

Attribute.RawValue: The icon to use in the Button. See also, IconCls to set an icon with a custom Css class.

ConfigOption.Name: IconCls
ConfigOption.Summary: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button.

Attribute.RawValue: A css class which sets a background image to be used as the icon for this button.

Class.Name: TabCloseMenu
Class.Summary: Very simple plugin for adding a close context menu to tabs

Attribute.RawValue: Very simple plugin for adding a close context menu to tabs

ConfigOption.Name: CloseTabText
ConfigOption.Summary: Text to display in ContextMenu for menu option to close current Tab.

Attribute.RawValue: Text to display in ContextMenu for menu option to close current Tab.

ConfigOption.Name: ShowCloseOthers
ConfigOption.Summary: Indicates whether to show the 'Close Others' option. Defaults to 'true'.

Attribute.RawValue: Indicates whether to show the 'Close Others' option. Defaults to 'true'.

ConfigOption.Name: CloseOtherTabsText
ConfigOption.Summary: Text to display in ContextMenu for menu option to close other Tabs.

ConfigOption.Name: ShowCloseAll
ConfigOption.Summary: Indicates whether to show the 'Close All' option. Defaults to 'true'.

ConfigOption.Name: CloseAllTabsText
ConfigOption.Summary: The text for closing all tabs. Defaults to 'Close All Tabs'.

ConfigOption.Summary: Editor options

ConfigOption.Name: ColumnModel
ConfigOption.Summary: Column definitions which define all columns that appear in this grid. Each column definition provides the header text for the column, and a definition of where the data for that column comes from.

Attribute.RawValue: Column definitions which define all columns that appear in this grid. Each column definition provides the header text for the column, and a definition of where the data for that column comes from.

ConfigOption.Name: DeferRowRender
ConfigOption.Summary: Defaults to true to enable deferred row rendering.

Attribute.RawValue: Defaults to true to enable deferred row rendering.

ConfigOption.Name: EnableColumnHide
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable hiding of columns with the header context menu.

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable hiding of columns with the header context menu.

ConfigOption.Name: EnableColumnMove
ConfigOption.Summary: True to enable drag and drop reorder of columns.

Attribute.RawValue: True to enable drag and drop reorder of columns.

ConfigOption.Name: EnableColumnResize
ConfigOption.Summary: False to turn off column resizing for the whole grid (defaults to true).

Attribute.RawValue: False to turn off column resizing for the whole grid (defaults to true).

ConfigOption.Name: ForceFit
ConfigOption.Summary: Specify as true to force the columns to fit into the available width. Headers are first sized according to configuration, whether that be a specific width, or flex. Then they are all proportionally changed in width so that the entire content width is used.

Attribute.RawValue: Specify as true to force the columns to fit into the available width. Headers are first sized according to configuration, whether that be a specific width, or flex. Then they are all proportionally changed in width so that the entire content width is used.

ConfigOption.Name: HideHeaders

ConfigOption.Name: Scroll

Attribute.RawValue: Valid values are 'both', 'horizontal', 'vertical' or 'none'. Defaults to Both.

ConfigOption.Name: ScrollDelta
ConfigOption.Summary: Number of pixels to scroll when scrolling with mousewheel. Defaults to 40.

Attribute.RawValue: Number of pixels to scroll when scrolling with mousewheel. Defaults to 40.

ConfigOption.Name: SortableColumns
ConfigOption.Summary: Defaults to true. Set to false to disable column sorting via clicking the header and via the Sorting menu items.

Attribute.RawValue: Defaults to true. Set to false to disable column sorting via clicking the header and via the Sorting menu items.

ConfigOption.Name: GetRowClass
ConfigOption.Summary: Override this function to apply custom CSS classes to rows during rendering. You can also supply custom parameters to the row template for the current row to customize how it is rendered using the rowParams parameter. This function should return the CSS class name (or empty string '' for none) that will be added to the row's wrapping div. To apply multiple class names, simply return them space-delimited within the string (e.g., 'my-class another-class').

Attribute.RawValue: Override this function to apply custom CSS classes to rows during rendering. You can also supply custom parameters to the row template for the current row to customize how it is rendered using the rowParams parameter. This function should return the CSS class name (or empty string '' for none) that will be added to the row's wrapping div. To apply multiple class names, simply return them space-delimited within the string (e.g., 'my-class another-class').

Class.Name: TabPanel
Class.Summary: A basic tab content Container. Tab panels can be used exactly like a standard Ext.Panel for layout purposes, but also have special support for containing child Panels that get automatically converted into tabs.

Attribute.RawValue: "<{0}:TabPanel runat=\"server\" Height=\"300\"><Items><{0}:Panel runat=\"server\" Title=\"Tab 1\"><Items></Items></{0}:Panel><{0}:Panel runat=\"server\" Title=\"Tab 2\"><Items></Items></{0}:Panel><{0}:Panel runat=\"server\" Title=\"Tab 3\"><Items></Items></{0}:Panel></Items></{0}:TabPanel>"

A basic tab content Container. Tab panels can be used exactly like a standard Ext.Panel for layout purposes, but also have special support for containing child Panels that get automatically converted into tabs.

Class.Summary: Multiline text field. Can be used as a direct replacement for traditional textarea <asp:TextBox TextMode='MultiLine'> fields, plus adds support for auto-sizing.

ConfigOption.Name: Cols
