Attribute.RawValue: An initial value for the 'cols' attribute on the textarea element. This is only used if the component has no configured width and is not given a width by its container's layout. Defaults to 4.

ConfigOption.Name: EnterIsSpecial
ConfigOption.Summary: True if you want the enter key to be classed as a special key. Special keys are generally navigation keys (arrows, space, enter). Setting the config property to true would mean that you could not insert returns into the textarea. (defaults to false)

Attribute.RawValue: True if you want the enter key to be classed as a special key. Special keys are generally navigation keys (arrows, space, enter). Setting the config property to true would mean that you could not insert returns into the textarea. (defaults to false)

ConfigOption.Name: GrowAppend
ConfigOption.Summary: A string that will be appended to the field's current value for the purposes of calculating the target field size. Only used when the grow config is true. Defaults to a newline for TextArea to ensure there is always a space below the current line.

Attribute.RawValue: A string that will be appended to the field's current value for the purposes of calculating the target field size. Only used when the grow config is true. Defaults to a newline for TextArea to ensure there is always a space below the current line.

ConfigOption.Summary: True if this field should automatically grow and shrink to its content (defaults to false).

ConfigOption.Summary: A string that will be appended to the field's current value for the purposes of calculating the target field size. Only used when the grow config is true. Defaults to a single capital \"W\" (the widest character in common fonts) to leave enough space for the next typed character and avoid the field value shifting before the width is adjusted.

ConfigOption.Name: MaxLength
ConfigOption.Summary: Maximum input field length allowed by validation (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE). This behavior is intended to provide instant feedback to the user by improving usability to allow pasting and editing or overtyping and back tracking. To restrict the maximum number of characters that can be entered into the field use the enforceMaxLength option.

Attribute.RawValue: Maximum input field length allowed by validation (defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE). This behavior is intended to provide instant feedback to the user by improving usability to allow pasting and editing or overtyping and back tracking. To restrict the maximum number of characters that can be entered into the field use the enforceMaxLength option.

Class.Name: ToolTip
Class.Summary: ToolTip is a Ext.tip.Tip implementation that handles the common case of displaying a tooltip when hovering over a certain element or elements on the page. It allows fine-grained control over the tooltip's alignment relative to the target element or mouse, and the timing of when it is automatically shown and hidden.

Attribute.RawValue: ToolTip is a Ext.tip.Tip implementation that handles the common case of displaying a tooltip when hovering over a certain element or elements on the page. It allows fine-grained control over the tooltip's alignment relative to the target element or mouse, and the timing of when it is automatically shown and hidden.

ConfigOption.Name: Anchor
ConfigOption.Summary: If specified, indicates that the tip should be anchored to a particular side of the target element or mouse pointer (\"top\", \"right\", \"bottom\", or \"left\"), with an arrow pointing back at the target or mouse pointer. If constrainPosition is enabled, this will be used as a preferred value only and may be flipped as needed.

Attribute.RawValue: If specified, indicates that the tip should be anchored to a particular side of the target element or mouse pointer (\"top\", \"right\", \"bottom\", or \"left\"), with an arrow pointing back at the target or mouse pointer. If constrainPosition is enabled, this will be used as a preferred value only and may be flipped as needed.

ConfigOption.Name: AnchorOffset
ConfigOption.Summary: A numeric pixel value used to offset the default position of the anchor arrow. When the anchor position is on the top or bottom of the tooltip, anchorOffset will be used as a horizontal offset. Likewise, when the anchor position is on the left or right side, anchorOffset will be used as a vertical offset. Defaults to: 0

Attribute.RawValue: A numeric pixel value used to offset the default position of the anchor arrow. When the anchor position is on the top or bottom of the tooltip, anchorOffset will be used as a horizontal offset. Likewise, when the anchor position is on the left or right side, anchorOffset will be used as a vertical offset. Defaults to: 0

ConfigOption.Name: AnchorToTarget
ConfigOption.Summary: True to anchor the tooltip to the target element, false to anchor it relative to the mouse coordinates. When anchorToTarget is true, use defaultAlign to control tooltip alignment to the target element. When anchorToTarget is false, use anchor instead to control alignment. Defaults to: true

Attribute.RawValue: True to anchor the tooltip to the target element, false to anchor it relative to the mouse coordinates. When anchorToTarget is true, use defaultAlign to control tooltip alignment to the target element. When anchorToTarget is false, use anchor instead to control alignment. Defaults to: true

ConfigOption.Name: AutoHide
ConfigOption.Summary: True to automatically hide the tooltip after the mouse exits the target element or after the dismissDelay has expired if set (defaults to true). If closable = true a close tool button will be rendered into the tooltip header.

Attribute.RawValue: True to automatically hide the tooltip after the mouse exits the target element or after the dismissDelay has expired if set (defaults to true). If closable = true a close tool button will be rendered into the tooltip header.

ConfigOption.Name: Delegate
ConfigOption.Summary: A DomQuery selector which allows selection of individual elements within the target element to trigger showing and hiding the ToolTip as the mouse moves within the target.

Attribute.RawValue: A DomQuery selector which allows selection of individual elements within the target element to trigger showing and hiding the ToolTip as the mouse moves within the target.

ConfigOption.Name: DismissDelay
ConfigOption.Summary: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip automatically hides (defaults to 5000). To disable automatic hiding, set dismissDelay = 0.

Attribute.RawValue: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip automatically hides (defaults to 5000). To disable automatic hiding, set dismissDelay = 0.

ConfigOption.Name: HideDelay
ConfigOption.Summary: Delay in milliseconds after the mouse exits the target element but before the tooltip actually hides (defaults to 200). Set to 0 for the tooltip to hide immediately.

Attribute.RawValue: Delay in milliseconds after the mouse exits the target element but before the tooltip actually hides (defaults to 200). Set to 0 for the tooltip to hide immediately.

ConfigOption.Name: MouseOffset
ConfigOption.Summary: An XY offset from the mouse position where the tooltip should be shown (defaults to [15,18]).

Attribute.RawValue: An XY offset from the mouse position where the tooltip should be shown (defaults to [15,18]).

ConfigOption.Name: ShowDelay
ConfigOption.Summary: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip displays after the mouse enters the target element (defaults to 500).

Attribute.RawValue: Delay in milliseconds before the tooltip displays after the mouse enters the target element (defaults to 500).

ConfigOption.Name: Target
ConfigOption.Summary: The target id to associate with this tooltip.

Attribute.RawValue: The target id to associate with this tooltip.

ConfigOption.Name: TrackMouse
ConfigOption.Summary: True to have the tooltip follow the mouse as it moves over the target element (defaults to false).

Attribute.RawValue: True to have the tooltip follow the mouse as it moves over the target element (defaults to false).

Class.Summary: The TreeStore is a store implementation that is backed by by an Ext.data.Tree. It provides convenience methods for loading nodes, as well as the ability to use the hierarchical tree structure combined with a store. This class is generally used in conjunction with Ext.tree.Panel. This class also relays many events from the Tree for convenience.

Attribute.RawValue: The TreeStore is a store implementation that is backed by by an Ext.data.Tree. It provides convenience methods for loading nodes, as well as the ability to use the hierarchical tree structure combined with a store. This class is generally used in conjunction with Ext.tree.Panel. This class also relays many events from the Tree for convenience.

Class.Name: TriggerFieldBase
Class.Summary: Provides a convenient wrapper for TextFields that adds a clickable trigger button (looks like a combobox by default). The trigger has no default action, so you must assign a function to implement the trigger click handler by overriding onTriggerClick. You can create a TriggerField directly, as it renders exactly like a combobox for which you can provide a custom implementation.

Attribute.RawValue: Provides a convenient wrapper for TextFields that adds a clickable trigger button (looks like a combobox by default). The trigger has no default action, so you must assign a function to implement the trigger click handler by overriding onTriggerClick. You can create a TriggerField directly, as it renders exactly like a combobox for which you can provide a custom implementation.

Class.Summary: A config object containing any or all of the following properties. If this object is not specified the status will be cleared using the defaults.

Attribute.RawValue: A config object containing any or all of the following properties. If this object is not specified the status will be cleared using the defaults.

ConfigOption.Name: Duration
ConfigOption.Summary: The length of time in milliseconds that the progress bar should run before resetting itself (defaults to undefined, in which case it will run indefinitely until reset is called)

Attribute.RawValue: The length of time in milliseconds that the progress bar should run before resetting itself (defaults to undefined, in which case it will run indefinitely until reset is called)

ConfigOption.Name: Interval
ConfigOption.Summary: The length of time in milliseconds between each progress update (defaults to 1000 ms)

Attribute.RawValue: The length of time in milliseconds between each progress update (defaults to 1000 ms)

ConfigOption.Name: Animate
ConfigOption.Summary: Whether to animate the transition of the progress bar. If this value is not specified, the default for the class is used.

Attribute.RawValue: Whether to animate the transition of the progress bar. If this value is not specified, the default for the class is used.

ConfigOption.Name: Increment
ConfigOption.Summary: The number of progress update segments to display within the progress bar (defaults to 10). If the bar reaches the end and is still updating, it will automatically wrap back to the beginning.

Attribute.RawValue: The number of progress update segments to display within the progress bar (defaults to 10). If the bar reaches the end and is still updating, it will automatically wrap back to the beginning.

ConfigOption.Name: Text
ConfigOption.Summary: Optional text to display in the progress bar element (defaults to '').

Attribute.RawValue: Optional text to display in the progress bar element (defaults to '').

ConfigOption.Name: Fn
ConfigOption.Summary: A callback function to execute after the progress bar finishes auto-updating. The function will be called with no arguments. This function will be ignored if duration is not specified since in that case the progress bar can only be stopped programmatically, so any required function should be called by the same code after it resets the progress bar.

Attribute.RawValue: A callback function to execute after the progress bar finishes auto-updating. The function will be called with no arguments. This function will be ignored if duration is not specified since in that case the progress bar can only be stopped programmatically, so any required function should be called by the same code after it resets the progress bar.

ConfigOption.Name: Scope
ConfigOption.Summary: The scope that is passed to the callback function (only applies when duration and fn are both passed).
